commit_message:
Remove redundant body validation for createBackup

The body validation is redundant for createBackup, should remove it. In
fact that this extension is registered as WSGI action implies that the
body must contain a key with the same name as action.

Change-Id: I327688b2df50782bc38b97a4750f83a607623ce4
Closes-Bug: #1254988

commit_message:
Enables quota extension on BigSwitch plugin

Adds quotas to supported extensions in
BigSwitch plugin and adds db migration script
to create quota tables for BigSwitch plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1266334

commit_message:
Moves negative tests from test_absolute_limits

This change set moves the negative tests in
tempest/api/compute/limits/test_absolute_limits to
a new file test_absolute_limits_negative

Also removes usage of modules directly.

Note: HACKING.rst
The second requirement is that all negative tests must be added to
a negative test file. If such a file doesn't exist for the particular
resource being tested a new test file should be added

Change-Id: Ia331fc4089c773025e192eeef7b0546020d628b8

commit_message:
Adds simple tenant usage support for the Nova V3 API

Adds support and tests for the os-simple-tenant-usage
extension for the Nova V3 API. There are no
differences between the V2 and V3 API and this change
adds the client code to enable the usage command. Note
that with nomenclature change from tenant to project
occuring in Nova there will be a difference between
the V2 and V3 API in the future.

Differences between the V2 and V3 API are described here:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaAPIv2tov3

Partially implements blueprint v3-api

Change-Id: Iddf6211c9c87cbb191d9a5d5a65710b343c30e67

Noticed that the configuration.rst file for the example extension

commit_message:
Move extension example docs around

Noticed that the configuration.rst file for the example extension
was not under docs.

The patch moved the file to docs, but does not link it back in the
configuration.rst file.

Also added a README file to the example extension that reminds
authors to place docs in the right spot.

Change-Id: If57bf08195b184346bcbfb6bbc7e037bf48b6c9e

commit_message:
Remove test_auth_token.py

The tests in test_auth_token didn't really add an value. They just
ran a server list command and hoped it didn't throw an exception. If
there was an issue with this then all the api tests would fail, so
there is no value in these tests.

Change-Id: I14e0c0284170219c028454990f189440ffeb0b08

commit_message:
Removes disk-config extension from v3 api

This patch removes disk-config extension for v3 api, and also
remove related tests. And remove resize extension point for
servers core because there isn't any extension using it anymore
and there isn't good way to test resize extension point.

Implements bp api-v3-remove-disk-config
DocImpact

Change-Id: I894ae6f4e0d6c9f956a71e8e061ccb3fa1b039d8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-10 16:18:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add trigger to start provisioning the node

Expose in the API a way to trigger the provisioning of a node. Client have
to do a PUT at /nodes/<uuid>/states/provision and in the body request
indicate the desired provision state for that node. In the moment only
'active' is a valid state, more states can be added later (for e.g to
trigger the unprovovision of the node). Also this call is async and
will return 202 (Accepted) in case the request was accepted and is in
progress. It will also return 409 (Conflict) in case there's a state
change already in progress or 400 if the supplied desired state is not
valid. No body message is returned, client should continue to GET the
status of the node to observe the status of the request, in the future
an URL to the /states subresource of the node should be added to the
Location header indicating that, right now setting the Location header
is not supported by WSME.

Change-Id: Iff315ccae9101b9736e3b9cc557cac01c26ac257

commit_message:
Implement API for provisioning

Expose do_node_deploy and do_node_tear_down in the API for /nodes/states.

Client have to do a PUT at /nodes/<uuid>/states/provision and in the body
request indicate the desired provision state for that node. This is an
async call and will return 202 (Accepted) in case the request was accepted
and is in progress. It will also return 409 (Conflict) in case there's
a state change already in progress or 400 if the supplied desired state
is not valid or if the node is already in the requested state. No body
message is returned, client should continue to GET the status of the node
to observe the status of the request, in the future an URL to the /states
subresource of the node should be added to the Location header indicating
that, right now setting the Location header is not supported by WSME.

Change-Id: Iff315ccae9101b9736e3b9cc557cac01c26ac257

commit_message:
API to validate UUID parameters

The patch uses the UuidType in the wsexpose decorator to make WSME
validate whether UUIDs parameters are UUID-like strings. By doing that,
it solves the problem of allowing ports to be accessed by its address,
which is an inconsistence in our API.

As our UuidType now differs from the UuidType of WSME the patch also
removes the note to remove our custom type on the next WSME release.

Change-Id: I023e8f31d94555577c4573b4a5cf0d649d33b4fa
Closes-Bug: #1246816

subject: Fix regression in Rackspace Cloud Servers tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-30 17:24:52.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/rackspace/heat/engine/plugins/cloud_server.py'], 'message': "Fix regression in Rackspace Cloud Servers tests

Commit 63b7f14403 introduced a regression in the Rackspace Cloud Server
tests.  Instance.volumes() now relies on its VOLUME property's default.
Since CloudServer inherits volumes() from Instance but defines its own
VOLUMES property, its VOLUMES property should also have a default.

Closes-Bug: #1265034
Change-Id: Ib17337c5d06aedf65da5497ad48858d649ba4e96
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix regression in Rackspace Cloud Servers tests

Commit 63b7f14403 introduced a regression in the Rackspace Cloud Server
tests.  Instance.volumes() now relies on its VOLUME property's default.
Since CloudServer inherits volumes() from Instance but defines its own
VOLUMES property, its VOLUMES property should also have a default.

Closes-Bug: #1265034

commit_message:
Moves negative tests from test_server_addresses

This change set moves the negative tests in
tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_addresses
to a new file test_server_addresses_negative

Also removes usage of modules directly.

Note: HACKING.rst
The second requirement is that all negative tests must be added to a negative
test file. If such a file doesn't exist for the particular resource being
tested a new test file should be added

Change-Id: If68d63c2617b9e045260e53616374d2d7f4d8035

subject: Fix to check "Response Status" in the "Response Body"
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-25 09:52:30.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/object_storage/test_object_slo.py'], 'message': 'Fix to check "Response Status" in the "Response Body"

Swift docs[1] says:
------------------------------
The response is similar to bulk deletes as in every response will be a
200 OK and you must parse the response body for actual results.
------------------------------
However, test_delete_large_object doesn't check it.
This commit fix it.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/misc.html#module-swift.common.middleware.bulk

Change-Id: If58395823718e07ba41ded00540b9362b729d0e9
Closes-Bug: #1264064
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix to check "Response Status" in the "Response Body"

Swift docs[1] says:
------------------------------
The response is similar to bulk deletes as in every response will be a
200 OK and you must parse the response body for actual results.
------------------------------
However, test_delete_large_object doesn't check it.
This commit fix it.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/misc.html#module-swift.common.middleware.bulk

Change-Id: If58395823718e07ba41ded00540b9362b729d0e9
Closes-Bug: #1264064

subject: Replace Simple/Chance Scheduler with FilterScheduler
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-23 17:10:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Replace Simple/Chance Scheduler with FilterScheduler

This patch replaces SimpleScheduler and ChanceScheduler with
FilterScheduler.  Scheduler manager is changed so that when it
detects 'scheduler_driver' is set to SimpleScheduler or
ChanceScheduler, it changes underlying scheduler driver to
FilterScheduler, and then host manager will use a pre-defined
combination of filters & weighers to keep scheduler behavior *MOSTLY*
the same as its old counterparts.

To simulate ChanceScheduler/SimpleScheduler, 'AvailabilityZoneFilter',
'CapacityFilter' and 'CapabilitiesFilter' are chosen to filter
out hosts that isn't in the target AZ, doesn't have sufficient
capacity and doesn't support needed capabilities.  And newly
added 'ChanceWeigher' will randomly pick a host from hosts
that passes above filters - just like ChanceScheduler does;
for SimpleScheduler, 'AllocatedCapacityWeigher' will sort hosts
with their 'allocated_capacity' - the one allocates the least
is the winner by default.

So the two new weigher, 'ChanceWeigher' and 'AllocatedCapacityWeigher'
are the key FilterScheduler to act identical when choosing
back-ends to serve requests.  The filters on the other hand,
are essential to make sure 'new' Simple/Chance Scheduler can support
volume types, encrpytion and QoS.

Partially implements bp: deprecate-chance-and-simple-schedulers

Change-Id: I0538b9692a23af6457ed463447fea8e564570848

commit_message:
Replace Simple/Chance Scheduler with FilterScheduler

This patch replaces SimpleScheduler and ChanceScheduler with
FilterScheduler. Scheduler manager is changed so that when it
detects 'scheduler_driver' is set to SimpleScheduler or
ChanceScheduler, it changes underlying scheduler driver to
FilterScheduler, and then host manager will use a pre-defined
combination of filters & weighers to keep scheduler behavior *MOSTLY*
the same as its old counterparts.

To simulate ChanceScheduler/SimpleScheduler, 'AvailabilityZoneFilter',
'CapacityFilter' and 'CapabilitiesFilter' are chosen to filter
out hosts that isn't in the target AZ, doesn't have sufficient
capacity and doesn't support needed capabilities. And newly
added 'ChanceWeigher' will randomly pick a host from hosts
that passes above filters - just like ChanceScheduler does;
for SimpleScheduler, 'AllocatedCapacityWeigher' will sort hosts
with their 'allocated_capacity' - the one allocates the least
is the winner by default.

So the two new weigher, 'ChanceWeigher' and 'AllocatedCapacityWeigher'
are the key FilterScheduler to act identical when choosing
back-ends to serve requests. The 3 filters on the other hand,
are essential to make sure this 'new' Simple/Chance Scheduler can
support volume types, encryption and QoS.

Partially implements bp: deprecate-chance-and-simple-schedulers

Change-Id: I0538b9692a23af6457ed463447fea8e564570848

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-07 15:54:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Filter resource types by support status

Add extra argument 'support_status' to list_resource_types
function in heat/api and heat/engine. It allows to filter results
by support status when querying the api for resource types.

Add new field 'support_status' to ResourceInfo class.
support_status='UNKNOWN' by default.

Add new function 'get_types_with_status' to
ResourceRegistry and Environment classes in
heat/engine/environment.py. Function 'get_types_with_status'
from ResourceRegistry class returns resource types filtered
by support_status.

Add function 'get_types_with_status' to
heat/engine/resource.py. It returns an iterator over the list
of resource types with current status.

Add suitable changes to tests:
- heat/tests/test_api_openstack_v1.py
- heat/tests/test_engine_service.py
- heat/tests/test_rpc_client.py

Implements bp filter-resources-by-support

Change-Id: I719c0d690886153adb698aea4695ddd526e7a4af

commit_message:
Filter resource types by support status

Now heat resources haven't support status. We want service providers
to have a way to assign support status metadata to resources. And
then user should be able to filter resource types by support status
when quering the api for resource types.

Add processing of query parameter support_status to list_resource_types
function in heat/api to filter resources by. List_resource_types
returns a list of resources with a certain status or a list of all
resource types by default.

Add filtering on the server.

Add changes to tests:
- test_rpc_client.py
- test_api_openstack_v1.py
- test_engine_service.py

Implements bp filter-resources-by-support

Change-Id: I719c0d690886153adb698aea4695ddd526e7a4af

subject: Return 403 for exception.Forbidden exceptions
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-23 09:04:34.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/api/v1/members.py'], 'message': 'Return 403 for exception.Forbidden exceptions

Currently the following Glance v1 operations:
    - Deleting a member from an image
    - Updating image membership
    - Updating all members of an image
return HTTPNotFound even when the underlying system returns
exception.Forbidden.

This commit returns the corresponding HTTP errors.

Change-Id: Ibd34d515b83f658bbca2d102d6b582faf118faa6
Closes-bug: #1199359
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Return 403 for exception.Forbidden exceptions

Currently the following Glance v1 operations:
    - Deleting a member from an image
    - Updating image membership
    - Updating all members of an image
return HTTPNotFound even when the underlying system returns
exception.Forbidden.

This commit returns the corresponding HTTP errors.

Change-Id: Ibd34d515b83f658bbca2d102d6b582faf118faa6
Closes-bug: #1199359

Deleted TEMPDIR on exit

To avoid undeleted tmp.XXXXXXXXX directories left in /tmp, and output
unified style patch for later apply.

This is to enable the various distros to easily override the
hard-coded default nested template (which currently only supports

commit_message:
Make LoadBalancer nested stack template configurable

Reviving work originally posted by Angus Salkeld under
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21405/

This is to enable the various distros to easily override the
hard-coded default nested template (which currently only supports
Fedora 17) with a template approporate to their distro, and
enables deployers to specify their own template (although the
latter use-case will probably be catered for via a provider
template implementation long-term).

Change-Id: I0a4eccb23b2eebbf31b7aabf0fe85ab31f0ca971
Partial-Bug: #1234375
Co-Authored-By: Angus Salkeld <angus@salkeld.id.au>

commit_message:
Add policy enforcement to ReST API

Currently the native API lacks support for enforcing policy via
policy.json, as is possible for the aws-compatible APIs.

So modify and rename the tenant_local decorator to also enforce
policy, and add tests to ensure the API controllers are all
using the decorator on their actions

Change-Id: Id80d576d5ff5e546da42dbf08ebd653005af14ff
blueprint: request-scoping-policy

If a user runs 'nova service-list --binary something-weird', where
something-weird is a binary that is not listed the result is a confusing
IndexError. That is because the result is expected to always have at
least one result.

Part of the reason for that is that the fake client does not make it
easy to simulate an empty response in tests. That is why there is no

Change-Id: I3e6798d63a662c245196b3bf95bb7e1b0ea9c3a4
Partial-Bug: #1260504

Part of the reason for that is that the fake client does not make it

Change-Id: I3e6798d63a662c245196b3bf95bb7e1b0ea9c3a4

commit_message:
Allow empty response in service-list

If a user runs 'nova service-list --binary something-weird', where
something-weird is a binary that is not listed the result is a confusing
IndexError. That is because the result is expected to always have at
least one result.

Part of the reason for that is that the fake client does not make it
easy to simulate an empty response in tests. That is why there is no
regression test associated with this bug-fix. That is also why I am
marking thas as Partial-Bug, as this corrects the symptom, but it does
not prevent it from regressing.

Change-Id: I3e6798d63a662c245196b3bf95bb7e1b0ea9c3a4
Partial-Bug: #1260504

Closes-Bug: #1263297
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Do not override cloud-init cloud_config_modules

In the past it may have been necessary to do this but it causes problems
for users of advanced features. We should be able to operate with the
default OS configuration of cloud-init.

Change-Id: Ic26bffb17b1870d656fea72cf3da3dfe2b7f44d0
Closes-Bug: #1263297

subject: Make scheduler rpcapi use object serializer
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-25 15:19:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make scheduler rpcapi use object serializer

The scheduler rpcapi is still using NoOpSerializer which can't serialize
objects. When testing with objects for instance flavor, filter_properties
can not be serialized because its structure is:

{'instance_type': <nova.objects.flavor.Flavor object at 0x6862d10>,
'scheduler_hints': {}}

Change-Id: I0a9a02eefc051738183e0393ae0c462d60c74fef
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-12-27 07:05:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/rpcapi.py'], 'message': "Make scheduler rpcapi use object serializer

The scheduler rpcapi is still using NoOpSerializer which can't serialize
objects. When testing with objects for instance flavor, filter_properties
can not be serialized because its structure is:

{'instance_type': <nova.objects.flavor.Flavor object at 0x6862d10>,
'scheduler_hints': {}}

If the scheduler uses objects, its serializer can not be NoOPSerializer.

Related to blueprint icehouse-objects.

Change-Id: I0a9a02eefc051738183e0393ae0c462d60c74fef
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Make scheduler rpcapi use object serializer

The scheduler rpcapi is still using NoOpSerializer which can't serialize
objects. When testing with objects for instance flavor, filter_properties
can not be serialized because its structure is:

{'instance_type': <nova.objects.flavor.Flavor object at 0x6862d10>,
'scheduler_hints': {}}

If the scheduler uses objects, its serializer can not be NoOPSerializer.

Related to blueprint icehouse-objects.

Change-Id: I0a9a02eefc051738183e0393ae0c462d60c74fef

subject: Fix coding error in AvailabilityZoneFilter
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-01-05 14:28:36.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/openstack/common/scheduler/filters/availability_zone_filter.py'], 'message': 'Fix coding error in AvailabilityZoneFilter

In AvailabilityZoneFilter, if request_spec does not include
resource_properties, AvailabilityZoneFilter will set default value
of resource_properties as [], this is not right, we should use {}
instead.

Oslo is correct and was using {} as default value.

Change-Id: Id5fa13c0353eb5213ec828d98770955a9d6a1b03
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix coding error in AvailabilityZoneFilter

In AvailabilityZoneFilter, if request_spec does not include
resource_properties, AvailabilityZoneFilter will set default value
of resource_properties as [], this is not right, we should use {}
instead.

Oslo is correct and was using {} as default value.

Change-Id: Id5fa13c0353eb5213ec828d98770955a9d6a1b03

commit_message:
Fixes for building

* Fix path to ha build script
* Do not force building of books if --api-site is given, the code
  is correct, it just falls over invalid xml. Patches have been
  sent to fix the XML.
* Validate also XML files that are in samples directory or
  in wadls directory - but only validate for proper XML, do not
  validate against any schema

Change-Id: Ifca12ddf8f3fbd23bacf77e4d5930e450162ee05

commit_message:
generalize use of array for $alarm_package_name

ceilometer::params::alarm_package_name was an array on Debian and
a string on RedHat.

The patch also simplify the Package → Service relationship declaration.
Package are now only declared in init.php to avoid the case a
Package['ceilometer-alarm'] was declared two time (evaluator.pp and
notifier.pp).

Change-Id: If1e52623c5f3fee6edf7157b5e2d63e004385900

Remove start index 0 in range()

value is 0, to make code cleaner.

Refactoring the shards and catalogue mongo database methods into a
single method because there's no need for these to access different
logical databases.

removed unused context in check_*** methods

Input parameter 'context' of Check_*** methods(check_attach,
check_detach, _check_metadata_properties, _check_volume_availability)
in cinder/volume/api.py are not being used, so remove this 'context'
parameter.

Closes-bug: #1265725

subject: add 'force' verification in _volume_upload_image
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-01-03 08:00:20.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/contrib/volume_actions.py'], 'message': "add 'force' verification in _volume_upload_image

_volume_upload_image API should only support to upload 'in-use' volume to
image when assign 'force' parameter as true value. Now
_volume_upload_image API does not do verification for 'force' parameter,
so we can upload 'in-use' volume to image when assign 'force' parameter
with string value 'false' or 'false111'. This patch add verification for
'force' parameter.

Change-Id: I9e1d0e517d0ff97c136903dd6e50a305e18651f3
Closes-Bug: #1265718
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
add 'force' verification in _volume_upload_image

_volume_upload_image API should only support to upload 'in-use' volume to
image when assign 'force' parameter as true value. Now
_volume_upload_image API does not do verification for 'force' parameter,
so we can upload 'in-use' volume to image when assign 'force' parameter
with string value 'false' or 'false111'. This patch add verification for
'force' parameter.

Change-Id: I9e1d0e517d0ff97c136903dd6e50a305e18651f3
Closes-Bug: #1265718

Change-Id: I0521ab162220c66a62491ff8e7e4a9f6d7bef6c4
', 'number': 5}]
commit_message:
Fix race in get_network(s) in OVS plugin

Load network bindings eagerly with networks.
Otherwise a different db query could try to fetch network bindings
for already deleted networks. The issue is reproducible with
concurrent tempest network API tests.

Closes-Bug: 1263686
Change-Id: I0521ab162220c66a62491ff8e7e4a9f6d7bef6c4

commit_message:
unify keypair name handling

CreateKeyPair and ImportKeypair handled name checks in a different
way. When importing a keypair, one got a generic error message
without a hint, that the name was wrong.

Change-Id: Ie82c0cd21f70aae3f55b84a1c05c9f170eaec312
Closes-Bug: #1265563

add support for Django-1.6

Sessions now store JSON instead of pickled objects.

Partially-implements blueprint django-1point6

commit_message:
Remove the 'cmp' keyword from a call to 'sort()'

This keyword does not exist in Python 3, and 'key' should be used instead.

Change-Id: I0f92a1e3d389b491bf138c215e11e68fddc15477

commit_message:
Add general ceilometer concepts to guide

  The CLI guide did not contain the details of concepts such
  as meter, statistics and alarm. Since the next
  paragraphs included the commands to obtain these values, this
  would be confusing for newcomers.

  The fix includes the description of the concepts prior to the
  commands.

Change-Id: Ifdcc0e282e74838b9c420b140976c5767a06451b
Closes-Bug: #1263500

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 03:31:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix nova-compute starting failure bug

When starting nova-compute on compute node with lxc hypervisor,
a valueError exception will be raised because a libvirt usage bug
in function get_host_capabilities.

For libvirt interface baselineCPU() in python library, -1 will be
returned if basecpu info is None, not None or something else.

This patch is to fix this problem by correcting this libvirt usage
mistacke.

Change-Id: I5e4cb4a8d09b660edc4f6c6a4ad4bfe58a4dd5cb
Closes-bug: #1259796

a valueError exception will be raised because a libvirt bug of
the incorrect return value of baselineCPU() function, in function
get_host_capabilities, which introduced by commit
3b8c26321bce07b8ad588099c1fdcef858e748a8.

For libvirt interface baselineCPU() in python library, -1 will be
returned if basecpu info is None from version 1.1.2, and the return
value of this interface is corrected to None from version 1.2.0.

commit_message:
lxc: Fix a bug of baselineCPU parse failure

When starting nova-compute on compute node with lxc hypervisor,
a valueError exception will be raised because a libvirt bug of
the incorrect return value of baselineCPU() function, in function
get_host_capabilities, which introduced by commit
3b8c26321bce07b8ad588099c1fdcef858e748a8.

For libvirt interface baselineCPU() in python library, -1 will be
returned if basecpu info is None from version 1.1.2, and the return
value of this interface is corrected to None from version 1.2.0.

So a checking is added to make sure the return value of baselineCPU()
is not -1, and also a test case is added.

Closes-bug: #1259796

Co-authored-by: Wangpan <hzwangpan@corp.netease.com>

Change-Id: I5e4cb4a8d09b660edc4f6c6a4ad4bfe58a4dd5cb

commit_message:
Don't need session.flush in context managed by session

Within the scope of a single method, keeping all the reads and writes within
the context managed by a single session. In this way, the session's __exit__
handler will take care of calling flush() and commit() for you.
If using this approach, you should not explicitly call flush() or commit().
See http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_0_7/orm/session.html#committing

Closes-Bug: #1258044

Change-Id: I4f7d35e8aae67f3805a771ba8aab7c9e82511c93

commit_message:
Javascript force use of the curly braces.

    This option requires you to always put curly braces around blocks
in loops and conditionals. JavaScript allows you to omit curly braces
when the block consists of only one statement, in some circumstances,
it can lead to bugs.

Change-Id: If50546461813549b3a9cebb384eed7159c753c43
Implements: blueprint jshint-codestyle

subject: GlusterFS: Use correct base argument when deleting attached snaps
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-19 22:09:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "GlusterFS: Use correct base argument when deleting attached snaps

When deleting the most recent snapshot, the 'file_to_merge' field
which translates into the base= field for libvirt's blockRebase
call in Nova must be set depending on whether other snapshots exist.

If there are no other snapshots, base = None, which results in
libvirt clearing the qcow2 backing file pointer for the active
disk image.

If there are other snapshots, pass the parent of the file being
deleted as the new base file.  The snapshot info pointer for the
prior base file must also be updated in this case.

Closes-Bug: #1262880

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-12-19 22:09:45.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/glusterfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_glusterfs.py'], 'message': "GlusterFS: Use correct base argument when deleting attached snaps

which translates into the base= field for libvirt's blockRebase
call in Nova must be set depending on whether other snapshots exist.

If there are no other snapshots, base = None, which results in
libvirt clearing the qcow2 backing file pointer for the active

If there are other snapshots, pass the parent of the file being
deleted as the new base file.  The snapshot info pointer for the

Closes-Bug: #1262880
Change-Id: If7bc8259b031d0406346caafb8f688e65a38dba6
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
GlusterFS: Use correct base argument when deleting attached snaps

When deleting the most recent snapshot, the 'file_to_merge' field
which translates into the base= field for libvirt's blockRebase
call in Nova must be set depending on whether other snapshots exist.

If there are no other snapshots, base = None, which results in
libvirt clearing the qcow2 backing file pointer for the active
disk image.

If there are other snapshots, pass the parent of the file being
deleted as the new base file.  The snapshot info pointer for the
prior base file must also be updated in this case.

Closes-Bug: #1262880
Change-Id: If7bc8259b031d0406346caafb8f688e65a38dba6

commit_message:
Add UUID verification and UUID test case in object fields

For UUID type, verify whether it is UUID or not, and add unit test for UUID
field.

Change-Id: I612b52f5fe97ac05e334284f0e10b84b70edfa77

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 09:13:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add test for checking models with migrations

Each component of OpenStack uses models as base for service
and migrations as base for creation of database.
In fact there are a lot of differences in models with migrations.
And there is no test that could find them.

This patch adds opportunity to compare actual state of DB with models
in mysql and postgres dialects.

Will be checked:
- tables with shadow_tables,
- columns (name, type, lenght, default, nullable),
- constraints (indexes, unique constraints and foreign keys).

Also there is a alembic support for project which use alembic repo
as base or auxiliary.

bp: sync-models-with-migrations

And there is no test that could find them.

This patch adds opportunity to compare actual state of DB with models
in mysql and postgres dialects.

Will be checked:
- tables,
- columns (name, type, lenght, default, nullable),
- constraints (indexes, unique constraints and foreign keys).

Also there is a alembic support for project which use alembic repo
as base or auxiliary.
For each test it's own database will be used.
After ending all temporary databases will be removed.

bp: sync-models-with-migrations

commit_message:
Add test for checking models with migrations

Each component of OpenStack uses models as base for service
and migrations as base for creation of database.
In fact there are a lot of differences in models with migrations.
And there is no test that could find them.

This patch adds opportunity to compare actual state of DB with models
in mysql and postgres dialects.

Will be checked:
- tables,
- columns (name, type, lenght, default, nullable),
- constraints (indexes, unique constraints and foreign keys).

Also there is an alembic support for project which use alembic repo
as base or auxiliary.
For each test it's own database will be used.
After ending all temporary databases will be removed.

bp: sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I415e11864a1859cf074e4e55eb610ae8ce96e8c5

commit_message:
Adds XML deserializer for update of servers v3

The update of server didn't have deserializer that is different
with create, resize and rebuild. So the request of update can
be different with other actions. So makes it consistent.

Closes-bug: 1215711
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia5518116c3be9ff08f84f920ffcf64f7eee858b8

commit_message:
Mask Database user's password in trove api log

Currently passwords are logged in plaintext in trove api logs. This fix
will mask passwords in the log file.

Move log messages to the wsgi layer.

Change-Id: Id9dfa8645ace97c0582b19f88ba0d495b732ece7
Closes-Bug: #1254914

Delete instance faults when deleting instance

Instance delete should also delete related record from the
instance_faults table.

commit_message:
Remove unused fake_flags

fake_flags.py should have been removed in change
I3424d0a401b3ef7a3254d3e913263554361a52ff but somehow it's left
untouched in that change.  This module has been replaced by
cinder/tests/conf_fixture.py, and shouldn't be around anymore.

Change-Id: Ied840b95253d998c1b3326c1dde9d469fa783c85

subject: Add libxslt-devel and libxml2-devel deps to general for Fedora
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 8584, 'name': 'Perry Myers', 'email': 'pmyers@redhat.com', 'username': 'pmyers'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-01-03 19:46:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add libxslt and libxml2 deps to general for Fedora

Oslo incubator installation requires libxslt to be installed.  On
basic Fedora images (like the Fedora Cloud qcow2) libxslt is not
installed by default.  Running devstack on Fedora 20 fails because of
this.  The rpms/general file only specifies that libxslt and libxml2
should be installed for rhel6 distros.  This patch removes that
restriction so that those packages are installed on Fedora as well.

Change-Id: Iecf1272685a64bead5f9b2e6d2111800b731b596
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-01-03 20:19:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add libxslt and libxml2 deps to general for Fedora

oslo-rootwrap compilation requires libxslt-devel to be installed.
libxslt-devel and libxml2-devel are installed only on rhel6, this
patch installs them on Fedora as well.

Change-Id: Iecf1272685a64bead5f9b2e6d2111800b731b596
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-01-03 20:26:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add libxslt and libxml2 deps to general for Fedora

oslo-rootwrap has a dependency that requires libxslt-devel to be
installed for compilation.  libxslt-devel and libxml2-devel are
installed only on rhel6, this patch installs them on Fedora as well.

Change-Id: Iecf1272685a64bead5f9b2e6d2111800b731b596
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2014-01-03 21:03:05.000000000', 'files': ['files/rpms/general'], 'message': 'Add libxslt-devel and libxml2-devel deps to general for Fedora

oslo-rootwrap has a dependency that requires libxslt-devel to be
installed for compilation.  libxslt-devel and libxml2-devel are
installed only on rhel6, this patch installs them on Fedora as well.

Change-Id: Iecf1272685a64bead5f9b2e6d2111800b731b596
', 'number': 4}]
commit_message:
Add libxslt-devel and libxml2-devel deps to general for Fedora

oslo-rootwrap has a dependency that requires libxslt-devel to be
installed for compilation.  libxslt-devel and libxml2-devel are
installed only on rhel6, this patch installs them on Fedora as well.

Change-Id: Iecf1272685a64bead5f9b2e6d2111800b731b596

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-04 15:13:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Set "Disabled Reason" to None when enable nova compute

When use "nova host-update" to enable nova compute, the colume of
"Disabled Reason" will be set as empty, this will make the
"Disabled Reason" is not consistent with other services.
+------------------+------+----------+---------+-----------------+
| Binary           | Host | Zone     |   ...   | Disabled Reason |
+------------------+------+----------+---------+-----------------+
| nova-conductor   | jay1 | internal |   ...   | None            |
| nova-cert        | jay1 | internal |   ...   | None            |
| nova-scheduler   | jay1 | internal |   ...   | None            |
| nova-compute     | jay1 | nova     |   ...   |                 |
| nova-consoleauth | jay1 | internal |   ...   | None            |
+------------------+------+----------+---------+-----------------+

The fix was set the "Disabled Reason" to None when enable a nova
compute.

Change-Id: Ief1f21ba450812a240d30104624bcec92e3f989e
Closes-Bug: #1251803
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-12-04 23:28:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'libvirt: Set "Disabled Reason" to None when enable nova compute

commit_message:
libvirt: Set "Disabled Reason" to None when enable nova compute

When use "nova host-update" to enable nova compute, the column of
"Disabled Reason" will be set as empty, this will make the
"Disabled Reason" is not consistent with other services.

+------------------+------+----------+---------+-----------------+
| Binary           | Host |   Zone   |   ...   | Disabled Reason |
+------------------+------+----------+---------+-----------------+
| nova-conductor   | jay1 | internal |   ...   | None            |
| nova-cert        | jay1 | internal |   ...   | None            |
| nova-scheduler   | jay1 | internal |   ...   | None            |
| nova-compute     | jay1 | nova     |   ...   |                 |
| nova-consoleauth | jay1 | internal |   ...   | None            |
+------------------+------+----------+---------+-----------------+

The fix was set the "Disabled Reason" to None when enable a nova
compute.

Change-Id: Ief1f21ba450812a240d30104624bcec92e3f989e
Partial-Bug: #1251803

commit_message:
Debug Patch for VMware Minesweeper - no merge

Please do not review, we will not be merging this change. This
is to debug a critical issue with VMware CI Infrastructure.

We will abandon this patch sooner.

commit_message:
Make compatible with Cliff (1.5.2)

The most recent version of cliff changes the way formatters work.  This
temporarily disables the custom formatter to get the gate working
again.

Partial-Bug: #1265926
Change-Id: Id0fe9ca3ddf0326a88055f8767de4cbe4cadb950

commit_message:
Avoid not_done naming conflict

In order to make understanding the
usage of the 'not_done' variable easier
allow the schedule to take in the list
it will be appending to instead of relying
on a function local variable (which is
overwritten in the contained while loop)

Change-Id: I60c0c970d8fb444983e0d8b567ebe82c47e13d96

commit_message:
Name the graph property the same as in engine

In order to keep consistency between the engine
properties and the analyzer/decider properties
we should try to keep the naming the same (in
this case they both return the execution_graph).

Change-Id: I981d13c68ab597a91dadea2925183674d027ce0b

commit_message:
Fix file copy bug with the barbican installer.

The barbican installer (in bin/barbican.sh) is not copying files correctly
to user's environments, which breaks the install. This commit fixes that
issue.

Change-Id: I5fad5332bd329a4ca13b5843127fd6dc033ad45f

subject: Ensure hostname resolves correctly
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-12 19:41:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Ensure hostname resolves for rabbitmq

rabbitmq hangs on startup if the hostname for the system doesn't
resolve properly.  This change ensures that the hostname is added
to /etc/hosts so that will never happen with devstack.

Change-Id: I2c250f38f9feb18d1a59f3a457c6d01c1d98499c
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-12-31 20:24:13.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': "Ensure hostname resolves correctly

rabbitmq hangs on startup if the unqualified hostname for the
system doesn't resolve properly.  This change ensures that the
hostname is added to /etc/hosts so that will never happen with
devstack.

Change-Id: I2c250f38f9feb18d1a59f3a457c6d01c1d98499c
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Ensure hostname resolves correctly

rabbitmq hangs on startup if the unqualified hostname for the
system doesn't resolve properly.  This change ensures that the
hostname is added to /etc/hosts so that will never happen with
devstack.

Change-Id: I2c250f38f9feb18d1a59f3a457c6d01c1d98499c

revisions:

Rename "formatters" to "_formatters" to make that clear.

Change-Id: I993c948384201ef64c6fd0c957fa854bc4eed9d6
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-01-03 21:23:38.000000000', 'files': ['cliff/display.py', 'cliff/tests/test_lister.py'], 'message': 'Make the formatters a private part of the command

python-neutronclient was modifying the formatters set,

', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Make the formatters a private part of the command

python-neutronclient was modifying the formatters set,
but those objects were always meant to be private.
Rename "formatters" to "_formatters" to make that clear.

Change-Id: I993c948384201ef64c6fd0c957fa854bc4eed9d6

compute API, this patch refactors out the delegation method and makes
the simple_tenant_usage APIs go straight to flavors.get_flavor.

Change-Id: I374ebf48bb845a68b717ac14a3727084e00994a9

commit_message:
Remove get_instance_type from nova.compute.api

The get_instance_type method in nova.compute.api was simply delegating
to flavors.get_flavor so rather than rename it to get_flavor in the nova
compute API, this patch refactors out the delegation method and makes
the simple_tenant_usage APIs go straight to flavors.get_flavor.

Part of blueprint flavor-instance-type-dedup

Change-Id: I374ebf48bb845a68b717ac14a3727084e00994a9

commit_message:
Move live-migrate control flow into the conductor

Currently there are several calls from compute
to compute during live-migration. After this
change, all calls to compute come from the
conductor.

This is a step towards allowing the rollback
and retry operations to be controlled from
the conductor.

Part of blueprint live-migration-to-conductor
Change-Id: I51acfcb714c2e812b4d2b7079a963a5b5b7bbb0a

commit_message:
Allow passing arguments to tox

Pass extra arguments to tests.

This allows to run for example:
   tox -- --force

Also reorder elements of envlist.

Change-Id: Ia40305ccc02ef25e858bdace380f17ccce4b8646

subject: Make chassis_uuid field of nodes optional
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-01-02 17:42:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove the mandatory from chassis_uuid

Currently chassis is not being used by Ironic, it's nice to have it in
our API as a pre-design for grouping nodes that shares some capabilities
(e.g nodes that shares the firmware) or just as a way of grouping the
nodes for organization propouse. It shouldn't be mandatory to specify
a chassis uuid when creating one node since it might difficult other
things for e.g Migration, Nova doesn't have a similar abstraction, so

commit_message:
Make chassis_uuid field of nodes optional

Currently chassis is not being used by Ironic, it's nice to have it in
our API as a pre-design for grouping nodes that shares some capabilities
(e.g nodes that shares the firmware) or just as a way of grouping the
nodes for organization purpose. It shouldn't be mandatory to specify a
chassis uuid when creating one node since it might be difficult for other
things, eg. migration from Nova. Nova doesn't have a similar abstraction,
so it's impossible to determine which chassis the node belongs to when
migrating from it. So, this patch is making the chassis_uuid field of nodes
optional.

Change-Id: I9fe657ab11d809271eea44d734a5986655a5b303

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent "image" value on _get_image()

The type of "image" value is different on showing details of a server,
such as:
1. It's a dict while creating a server from a image
2. It's a empty string while creating a server from a volume

We should modify the type to dict, otherwise someone who call
the api will be confused about the value or can't parse the value
in the same way.

The patch just modifies the v3 api.

Change-Id: I0d7ce59f64adec0933353af58dc5b5170390674b
Closes-Bug: #1262039

(I tried my best to express what I mean using the
current WADL markup.)

Changed the url path structure.
http://api.openstack.org/api-ref-compute.html#os-quota-sets

Changed the sample responses to point to the new ones in
/api_samples/os-user-quotas/

For the other part, in the original bug description:
Add commands for project user quotas management.
     - Show user quotas:
       nova-manage project quota --project <Project name>
       --user <User name>
     - Update/Create user quotas:
       nova-manage project quota --project <Project name>
       --user <User name> --key <key> --value <value>
I found this page:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaManage
"The nova-manage isn't properly documented, but it's going away
in Folsom, so using this wiki page for quick docs on it."

Looks like the usage of this method still needs further
validation, so dose the API call.
It may need to be futher documented in
docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-ops/content/quotas.html

In the response:
"fixed_ips": -1
Does not seem to be right to have negative value for number
of IPs.
docs.openstack.org/user-guide-admin/content/cli_set_quotas.html
"Number of fixed IP addresses allowed per tenant. This number
must be equal to or greater than the number of allowed
instances."

Change-Id: Id4e08170ebf04ebb4ba846bf8b576a228b91441b
Closes-Bug: #1187277

commit_message:
Modify API ref for per-project-user quotas CRUD methods

**tenant** is an entity that owns the resources,
sometines called a project, sometimes the same as
a user

In addition to the owning entity (tenant), openstack
stores the entity performing the action as the **user**.

1st tenant ID in the URI, is the ID of the admin user
2ed tenant ID in the URI, is the project ID/Name
User ID is specified vis query string.
(I tried my best to express what I mean using the
current WADL markup.)

Changed the url path structure.
http://api.openstack.org/api-ref-compute.html#os-quota-sets

Changed the sample responses to point to the new ones in
/api_samples/os-user-quotas/

For the other part, in the original bug description:
Add commands for project user quotas management.
     - Show user quotas:
       nova-manage project quota --project <Project name>
       --user <User name>
     - Update/Create user quotas:
       nova-manage project quota --project <Project name>
       --user <User name> --key <key> --value <value>
I found this page:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaManage
"The nova-manage isn't properly documented, but it's going away
in Folsom, so using this wiki page for quick docs on it."

Looks like the usage of this method still needs further
validation, so dose the API call.
It may need to be futher documented in
docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-ops/content/quotas.html

In the response:
"fixed_ips": -1
Does not seem to be right to have negative value for number
of IPs.
docs.openstack.org/user-guide-admin/content/cli_set_quotas.html
"Number of fixed IP addresses allowed per tenant. This number
must be equal to or greater than the number of allowed
instances."

Change-Id: Id4e08170ebf04ebb4ba846bf8b576a228b91441b
Closes-Bug: #1187277

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-01-03 13:23:15.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/compute-api/src/api_samples/os-admin-actions/admin-actions-reset-state.xml', 'api-ref/src/wadls/netconn-api/src/api_samples/ports-get-resp.xml', 'api-ref/src/wadls/compute-api/src/api_samples/os-admin-actions/admin-actions-reset-state.json', 'api-ref/src/wadls/identity-api/src/v2.0/samples/authwithgroups.xml', 'api-ref/src/wadls/identity-api/src/v2.0/samples/endpoints.xml'], 'message': 'Fix invalid XML

* authwithgroups.xml: Ending tag should be same as opening one
* endpoints.xml: Remove duplicate tenantID="1" attribute
* admin-actions-reset-state.*: Deleted, it's not used anywhere and
  looking at the names, the file admin-actions-reset-server-state

commit_message:
Fix invalid XML

* authwithgroups.xml: Ending tag should be same as opening one
* endpoints.xml: Remove duplicate tenantID="1" attribute
* admin-actions-reset-state.*: Deleted, it's not used anywhere and
  looking at the names, the file admin-actions-reset-server-state
  handles this already
* ports-get-resp.xml: Fix XML code

Change-Id: Ia6b71c736ba92e170167db6ef7bf7f0158483e6a

commit_message:
Javascript force use of the identity operator

    In order to reduce possible bugs in our scripts the use of identity
operator must be mandatory over the equality operator. This rule force
developers to use the '===' and '!==' instead of '==' and '!='.

Change-Id: I1069ed2baed7bce305fce80d688a5a2c10249148
Implements: blueprint jshint-codestyle

commit_message:
Bind outside of the try block

If binding fails, we don't want to unbind
since there will be nothing bound, so do
the binding outside of the try/except
block to do this in the correct order.

Change-Id: Iebd3ea7a04265264043c47d4e943778538e8a153

subject: Raise type error instead of silencing it
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-30 20:35:34.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/persistence/backends/impl_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'Raise type error instead of silencing it

Instead of skipping the type error when invalid
configuration values are provided instead we should
just let the user know about these errors and let
said user handle them appropriatly (by not passing
in invalid configuration).

Change-Id: Id17258e5e06b47bcabd2bfd9d02b9d21181244be
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Raise type error instead of silencing it

Instead of skipping the type error when invalid
configuration values are provided instead we should
just let the user know about these errors and let
said user handle them appropriatly (by not passing
in invalid configuration).

Change-Id: Id17258e5e06b47bcabd2bfd9d02b9d21181244be

commit_message:
Switch to just using tox

Instead of requiring all the complicated
venv management logic that tox already provides
just use tox directly instead. This maps more
closely to what jenkins does, and how most other
python development occurs (which does not typically
rely on custom venv scripts).

Change-Id: Iff6cf0a7eb24ddd2ef65ddd723d0e4cb803b9bb9

[{'created': '2013-11-09 13:29:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'xenapi: add support for vcpu_pin_set

Change-Id: I9d53d93db0c5f2a11ad685d3fc335f0cd6b1f79b
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-11-09 16:59:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'xenapi: add support for vcpu_pin_set

Change-Id: I9d53d93db0c5f2a11ad685d3fc335f0cd6b1f79b
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-11-15 16:10:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'xenapi: add support for vcpu_pin_set

This moves vcpu-pin-set from the libvirt driver into the top level virt
driver, so it is more sensibly shared with the XenAPI driver.

XenAPI will only support values like:
"3,4,5,6,7,8"

There is validation code to ensure there is a valid value in the
config before setting that on the VM. It does not check to see if there
a physical CPUs for the given values, that would be too costly. We only
check that there is a comma separated list of integers.

The main use case for this setting is to ensure all guest VMs are not
using the physical CPUs that Dom0 are configured to use.

DocImpact
Completes blueprint xenapi-vcpu-pin-set
Change-Id: I9d53d93db0c5f2a11ad685d3fc335f0cd6b1f79b
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2013-11-20 18:01:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'xenapi: add support for vcpu_pin_set

This moves vcpu_pin_set config from the libvirt driver into a place that
can be shared between drivers, nova.virt.cpu

At the same time, the utility function that converts the configuration
value into a list of integers has also been moved into nova.virt.cpu

This new code is then used in the XenAPI driver to apply a CPU mask that
implements the currently configured value for vcpu_pin_set

The main use case for this setting is to ensure all guest VMs are not
using the physical CPUs that Dom0 are configured to use.

DocImpact
Completes blueprint xenapi-vcpu-pin-set
Change-Id: I9d53d93db0c5f2a11ad685d3fc335f0cd6b1f79b

At the same time, the utility function that converts the configuration
value into a list of integers has also been moved into nova.virt.cpu

This new code is then used in the XenAPI driver to apply a CPU mask that
implements the currently configured value for vcpu_pin_set

The main use case for this setting is to ensure all guest VMs are not
using the physical CPUs that Dom0 are configured to use.

DocImpact
Completes blueprint xenapi-vcpu-pin-set

commit_message:
xenapi: add support for vcpu_pin_set

This moves vcpu_pin_set config from the libvirt driver into a place that
can be shared between drivers, nova.virt.cpu

At the same time, the utility function that converts the configuration
value into a list of integers has also been moved into nova.virt.cpu

This new code is then used in the XenAPI driver to apply a CPU mask that
implements the currently configured value for vcpu_pin_set

The main use case for this setting is to ensure all guest VMs are not
using the physical CPUs that Dom0 are configured to use.

DocImpact
Completes blueprint xenapi-vcpu-pin-set
Change-Id: I9d53d93db0c5f2a11ad685d3fc335f0cd6b1f79b

Set a default if the backend configuration is not
provided as well as check for the configuration
being a dictionary instead of any arbitary non-false
type.

Instead of having a catch-all in check_flow_transition
that handles valid transitions to the RESUMING state we
should just have an explicit mapping of which old_state to
RESUMING state is valid. This is much easier to examine and
reason about then having to determine which states the
catch-all will allow/be affected by.

Change-Id: I3a4226b17bf5ad8e5453a3ff6bc9078f7c24b520
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Explicitly list the valid transitions to RESUMING state

Instead of having a catch-all in check_flow_transition
that handles valid transitions to the RESUMING state we
should just have an explicit mapping of which old_state to
RESUMING state is valid. This is much easier to examine and
reason about then having to determine which states the
catch-all will allow/be affected by.

Change-Id: I3a4226b17bf5ad8e5453a3ff6bc9078f7c24b520

commit_message:
Javascript coding style indent 2

    In order to improve the javascript coding style an indentation of
two spaces must be used in the whole project.
    A jshint option has been added, and all the files which violate
this rule have been corrected.
    In addition, some code style corrections have been made.

Implements: blueprint jshint-codestyle
Change-Id: Ic6428e77a06fd33b1c1298569fc01860c3e28690

commit_message:
Only retry once on non-resource manager exception

Currently we retry on all types of exceptions. This means it can take a
long time for an error to occur three times. However, for transient
errors, it is very helpful to at least retry the server build once.

However, we still get build failures due to scheduler races, so it would
be good to increase the number of retries for scheduler races.

This change looks at a compromise where if a non-resource manager
related exception occurs, only one retry is attempted, but for resource
manager exceptions we retry up to scheduler_max_attempts.

This change also increases the default max_attmepts to 10 from 3.

Change-Id: I5273be78ef4336724d1b54f8c5427a0b146b92ad

commit_message:
EventService exception handling to not log errors

In order to not log a StackNotFound exception as an error, the
identify_stack() method is now decorated with the
heat.openstack.common.rpc.client_exceptions wrapper.

Change-Id: I51adcfe4d86d312c9887e51e6c113f99e0f1b783
Closes-Bug: #1231135

commit_message:
VMware: use session.call_method to invoke api's

All api invocations should use session.call_method, which has a
retry mechanism to handle session failures. Few methods in vmops
that are not using this wrapper to invoke api's, fail
intermittently when the session is not authenticated.

This patch fixes those methods. This issue is more pronounced
during VMware CI (Minesweeper), where random tempest tests fail.

The existing tests for vmops and those added for the retrying
session in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/58890/ should cover
this change, as we are re-routing the api invocation.

Closes-Bug: #1260075
Change-Id: I2beb7c92a4c3f53fd2120629e8f72bfd54d13740

commit_message:
Fix interprocess locks for run_tests.sh

In recent change of commit 78d62186e5b0388f740d42cb8da5798cd67d7880 tox
test has been switched to use openstack.common.lockutils module for
interprocess locks. However, run_tests.sh is left unchanged, which hit a
regression when running tests with run_tests.sh

This change applies the same change in commit 78d621 for tox.ini to
run_tests.sh, i.e. using openstack.common.lockutils to create temporary
directory for locks and pass it as env variables to all tests.

Closes-Bug: #1264058
Change-Id: I007bd39e4d9aad7539b4b7389eb5189b5d1f10e2

commit_message:
Provide a script that starts a simple WSGI server

This provides an alternative to using screens in devstack
for reading logs. It works out-of-box, so there is no need
to install and configure something like Apache.

Change-Id: I8811d16cbcb45baaaa4a44b923b813a40714ffa2

commit_message:
xenapi: more info when assert_can_migrate fails

VM.assert_can_migrate can fail for many reasons. This makes it hard to
debug, so lets ensure we report the reason we get back from XenServer in
the exception that gets raised and saved into the instance_fault.

Change-Id: I3deb1169d6fe797ca74cd89061bbcf53d416e8d6

commit_message:
"mountpoint" should not be required parameter

The nova server supports attaching a volume to a server without taking
device name, so the "mountpoint" should not be required parameter on
VolumeAttachment in heat.

Change-Id: If5c978345c916a319cc150fe7edd86d5056c5b1f
Closes-Bug: #1265419

[{'created': '2013-11-20 14:52:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Compact pre-Icehouse database migrations <= 180.

Compacts the pre-Icehouse database migrations <= 180 into a
single migration (180_havana.py).

Pre-Icehouse users will now need to upgrade to Havana before
running any Icehouse migrations.

Tested on MySQL and PostgreSQL schemas on Fedora 19 to ensure the
new compacted migration generates an identical schema to the
previous migrate scripts in Havana.

Specific changes include:

 1) Add uniq_name_x_deleted, uniq_flavorid_x_deleted constraints.

 2) Add key_pairs_uniq_name_and_user_id constraint.

 3) Add uniq_instance_type_id_x_project_id_x_deleted constraint.

 4) Add uniq_address_x_deleted constraint (floating ips)

 5) Add availability_zone to volume_usage_cache.

 6) Add compute node stats index.

 7) Change cells deleted to int (except for shadow table
   which is handled in 181_fix_179_migration_sync_shadow_table)

Change-Id: I09fdb1a2e509a3d828b83b78d38a484fe405558b
Implements: blueprint compact-havana-db-migrations

commit_message:
Compact pre-Icehouse database migrations <= 180.

Compacts the pre-Icehouse database migrations <= 180 into a
single migration (180_havana.py).

Pre-Icehouse users will now need to upgrade to Havana before
running any Icehouse migrations.

Tested on MySQL and PostgreSQL schemas on Fedora 19 to ensure the
new compacted migration generates an identical schema to the
previous migrate scripts in Havana.

Specific changes include:

 1) Add uniq_name_x_deleted, uniq_flavorid_x_deleted constraints.

 2) Add key_pairs_uniq_name_and_user_id constraint.

 3) Add uniq_instance_type_id_x_project_id_x_deleted constraint.

 4) Add uniq_address_x_deleted constraint (floating ips)

 5) Add availability_zone to volume_usage_cache.

 6) Add compute node stats index.

 7) Change cells deleted to int (except for shadow table
   which is handled in 181_fix_179_migration_sync_shadow_table)

Change-Id: I09fdb1a2e509a3d828b83b78d38a484fe405558b
Implements: blueprint compact-havana-db-migrations

commit_message:
Replace some utils.bool_from_str with strutils

Instead of using novaclient.utils' bool_from_str, use bool_from_string
from the oslo incubating strutils

Notes:
 0. utils.bool_from_str was strict, only accepted a small set of
    values, while strutils.bool_from_string is not strict by default,
    anything not true is false
 1. bool_from_string accepts on/off, which bool_from_str did not

Change-Id: I04744844b55697819289def081d3c9117ed0713f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 612, 'name': 'Tom Fifield', 'email': 'tom@openstack.org', 'username': 'fifieldt'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 6062, 'name': 'jichenjc', 'email': 'jichenjc@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'jichenjc'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 7641, 'name': 'Shuangtai Tian', 'email': 'hitianst@gmail.com', 'username': 'shuangtai'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-01-02 12:13:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt_blockinfo.py', 'nova/virt/disk/api.py'], 'message': 'Revert change of default FS from ext3 to etx4

Change 2c3bff93269d9d7264e451cb17935313a56a1798  changed the default FS for
ephemeral disks from ext3 to ext4, but this has two problems:

i)  Not all GuestOS\x92s support ext3, so making this change requires a notification period
so that existing images and configurations on running systems can be modified to
still use ext3

ii) Ephemeral backing files use \x93default\x94 in their file name as a caching key.  This change
makes  "default"'s meaning is mutable and therefore the naming convention needs to
changed as part of the change to ext4 becoming the default FS.  Without this there will
be inconsistent behaviour between systems depending on whether the backing file
exists or not.

This change reverts the default to ext3 until these issues can be addressed.

Systems that need ext4 can achieve this use the existing configuration options.

Change-Id: I8de225729bbc77b263fcac2fa72b0e9cc6c1b2bf
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert change of default FS from ext3 to etx4

Change 2c3bff93269d9d7264e451cb17935313a56a1798  changed the default FS for
ephemeral disks from ext3 to ext4, but this has two problems:

i)  Not all GuestOSs support ext3, so making this change requires a notification period
so that existing images and configurations on running systems can be modified to
still use ext3

ii) Ephemeral backing files use default in their file name as a caching key.  This change
makes  "default"'s meaning is mutable and therefore the naming convention needs to
changed as part of the change to ext4 becoming the default FS.  Without this there will
be inconsistent behaviour between systems depending on whether the backing file
exists or not.

This change reverts the default to ext3 until these issues can be addressed.

Systems that need ext4 can achieve this use the existing configuration options.

Change-Id: I8de225729bbc77b263fcac2fa72b0e9cc6c1b2bf

commit_message:
Require hacking for additional checks

Require hacking for additional pep8 checks to follow
OpenStack python hacking conventions.

Fix problems found by hacking.

Disable autogenerate-config-docs from check, it needs further
work to be clean enough.

commit_message:
Warn about losing connectivity with add-port

Add a warning about how "ovs-vsctl add-port" will cause
loss of network connectivity if there is an IP associated with
the corresponding interface.

This issue came up on the openstack-operators mailing list:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2014-January/003831.html

Change-Id: I1c5d266cc3fd728cfe8638ced78ec1cf4d102c3c

commit_message:
Fixed device or resource busy issue in EXIT trap

cleanup for ramdisk failed to umount TMP_BUILD_DIR with device or
resource busy error.

The patch unmounts all the mountpoints under TMP_BUILD_DIR and
detaches loop devices associated with TMP_IMAGE_PATH.

The unmounts are applied with both force(-f) and lazy(-l)
options. Force option is only for NFS mounts, it's kept here since no
harm for lazy option.

Change-Id: I84035e6a003d8135186b2fda3facbd2c37967529

commit_message:
Fixed command dib-init-system not found error

dib-init-system is installed in 04-dib-init-system. Before it is
installed, 10-dib-init-system.bash may be sourced so command not found
issue found.

The patch invokes "/tmp/target.d/dib-init-system" directly in
10-dib-init-system.bash.

Change-Id: I9843224497c7dab8392261b26d62b6d79d1795ee

commit_message:
Add option to put seed public interface on OVS bridge

Add an option(-p) which names a OVS bridge on which to place the
seed public interface. This will be needed by the CI which expects
this interface to be on a OVS bridge rather then the libvirt default
network.

Change-Id: Ia006bbd78a1abf6ef5b0204e8b883bffdb9cf2a5

subject: Add option to set owner of seed image
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-01-03 09:51:11.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/setup-seed-vm'], 'message': 'Add option to set owner of seed image

Add an option(-u) that allows the calling process to set the
owner of the seed image. Setting this to something other then root
will allow CI to use a user other then root to copy files onto a test
environment host.

Change-Id: Ifa9563c7fd87eaf1ebe23828f7331a6311f9dd81
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add option to set owner of seed image

Add an option(-u) that allows the calling process to set the
owner of the seed image. Setting this to something other then root
will allow CI to use a user other then root to copy files onto a test
environment host.

Change-Id: Ifa9563c7fd87eaf1ebe23828f7331a6311f9dd81

commit_message:
make the bin scripts called with main()

This will make everything easier to manage and callable by other python
scripts/modules if you need to depend on the module. Others can then
just call the main() function instead of executing the script.

Closes-Bug: #1261823

Change-Id: I5e94ee19bd4f7a69d7ca5efc6288d402520cd5bf

commit_message:
Set image size after updating/adding locations

Based on current implement, the image size won't be updated if user
update/add locations against a queued image. This fix will set the
image size based on given location.

Closes-Bug: #1261624

Change-Id: I265c6a92274ab2f94e005a1ab50e01d2f0c2143e

commit_message:
Use assertTrue/False to assert boolean value

unittest.TestCase has methods assertTrue/assertFalse to assert boolean
value. But some test codes used assertEqual to compare with boolean
value. Using assertTrue/assertFalse is more readable and clear.
aslo less code.

Change-Id: Ic39092436357a208a93604ae28085c42eebd1b02
Close-Bug: #1265701

commit_message:
Enable mysqld service in mysql element

Enable mysqld service in mysql element rather than in boot-stack.
This fixes mysql element for systemd distros as previously boot-stack
install.d script tried to enable the service before mysqld had been
installed.

Change-Id: I35f53c0d0ca11e865f522a2b1b366c897fc40da7

commit_message:
Removes directory creation prior to _tmp_mount

Reasons:
- Directory creation is included in VolumeMountPoint.mount method.
- No need to repeat the steps before calling the mount method.

Changes:
- Removed directory creation prior to calling _tmp_mount.
- Test updated to reduce number of utils.execute,
  as we now have one less call in the code.

Change-Id: I5136f1ce537c919ff2e009cd617f33925d955e88
Closes-Bug: #1261905

commit_message:
Implement tables and unit tests for sqlalchemy storage backend

This is a translation of the sqlite tables to sqlalchemy.

In addition, there are simple tests for tables creation and
some basic execute operations.

Partially Implements blueprint sql-storage-driver

Change-Id: I2860033c0c3bcc9b965209271af74161f3a62818

commit_message:
Use neutron extension's 'alias' to identify an extension

In Neutron implement, extension's property 'name' is human-friendly
description, might include space. Property 'alias' is a word without
space, and is used to identify an extension. In Nova, we'd better
use 'alias' to keep same with Neutron.

Change-Id: I307b02d607b7fc8552455c2af9184f0a027516a0

commit_message:
Version handling

Add new parameter --version
pbr uses version number from git (via tags), so remove our own
version number. Once we tag a version "0.1", this will be the
version number.

Change-Id: Idcf9e4ddeebf637eb36797afd2855d1c657e52ea

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-26 07:26:02.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/manager.py'], 'message': "ValueError should use '%' instead of ','

The method _load_service_plugins() in /neutron/neutron/managers.py
 throw a ValueError using ',' to connect log and variables.
ValueError do not support using ',' to connect log and variables,
we should use '%' instead ','

Change-Id: Ib6ed7fa3ffca44c34c620e4e352a91c4addde751
Closes-Bug:#1264210
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
ValueError should use '%' instead of ','

The method _load_service_plugins() in /neutron/neutron/managers.py
 throw a ValueError using ',' to connect log and variables.
ValueError do not support using ',' to connect log and variables,
we should use '%' instead ','

Change-Id: Ib6ed7fa3ffca44c34c620e4e352a91c4addde751
Closes-Bug:#1264210

commit_message:
Check the length of aggregate metadata.

PostgreSQL gives an error if you try to shove 256+ characters
into a 255-character field. So we need raise a HTTPBadRequest
explanation if the length of aggregate_metadata.keys or
aggregate_metadata.values is above 255.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1219693

Change-Id: I350447f6a1538b322d25f71f414da3df105c10f5

subject: Have tox install via setup.py develop
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 17:17:01.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

commit_message:
Add alembic support to migrations testing

In some of OpenStack components we have alembic as migrate library.
This patch adds the opportunity to test alembic migrations in snake mode
(upgrade>downgrade>upgrade).

It was only migrate support before this.

bp: sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I7c6a2465809f510ee520d0878c108c8807f359f0

commit_message:
Add class for checking models with db(part II)

SyncModelsWithMigrations is extended by new helper methods for
checking equality models with db. Each method checks one of the
objects of table's structure:
- unique keys,
- foreign keys,
- indexes.

It will be used by test for checking of equality models to migrations
state.

bp: sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I35cf4eeeea210d0ce834e68a08e1aec1b8d3b1bb

commit_message:
Add option for enabling debug logs only for OpenStack

A new option --debug-openstack-only was introduced to enable debug logs
for OpenStack components, but not for external ones (e.g. ampq). Synced
from oslo-incubator.

Change-Id: I587a2c4fe86694b93c5691a6dfda5828cbd7bdad
Closes-Bug: #1207576

commit_message:
Add new Ceilometer combination alarm resource

This patch introduces a new OS::Ceilometer::CombinationAlarm resource
allowing the creation of combination alarms in Ceilometer.

Implements: blueprint ceilometer-combination-alarms
Change-Id: I8d7ba7f210423a5e7a1b1f1b86007fabdade7482

commit_message:
Define sheepdog_port as an integer value

It really is an integer value, and there is no magic string
that can be set for collie either (according to the man page)

Change-Id: I9af7c4208480f92378b7f70ab54c8a1e600dd4ff

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-09 10:24:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP Use oslo.db code

Instead of using ported version of wrapper around sqlalchemy code.
Use common db code from oslo and remove old db wrapper.

bp db-use-oslo-common-code

Change-Id: I3ff976545b1a82ff8df780e34128fcaf6f892b8c
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-07-11 09:46:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use common oslo.db code

Use common oslo database code for work around session, connection, engines
instead of glance implementation.
Removed some unused glance code and tests.

bp db-use-oslo-common-code

Change-Id: I3ff976545b1a82ff8df780e34128fcaf6f892b8c
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-07-11 11:54:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use common code from Oslo for work with database.

Use common oslo database code for work around session, connection, engines
instead of glance implementation. Removed some unused glance code and tests.

Details:

glance/cmd/manage.py
- changed db_sync() function call (single incoming parameter, not 2) due
  to changes in `glance/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py` file.
- removed load load the glance-registry config. We load sql connection
  in common code now.

glance/db/sqlalchemy/api.py
- removed function for work witn database lovel (_wrap_db_error(),
  _is_db_connection_error(), _get_maker(), get_engine(),
  _ping_listener()) and config `sql_connection_opt`. We have this
  data in module `glance.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy`.
- modified functions setup_db_env(), add_cli_options(),
  clear_db_env().
- functions _get_session() and get_engine() now call same
  functions from module `glance.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy`.
- replaced sqlalchemy exception `sqlalchemy.exc.IntegrityError` to
  database duplicate exception - `db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry`.

glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/012_id_to_uuid.py
- removed `meta` from global module functions to fixed race condition.

glance/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py
- general refactioring due to changes in nova
  migration module
- removed functions upgrade() and downgrade()
- function db_sync() modified - it takes single
  argument now.

glance/db/sqlalchemy/models.py
- created new base base model class based on common db code instead of
  class ModelBase(object).

glance/tests/functional/db/test_sqlalchemy.py
- modified work with config

glance/tests/integration/legacy_functional/base.py
- removed code for work with env variable 'GLANCE_DB_TEST_SQLITE_FILE'. There
  is a sense to use sqlite in memory only.

glance/tests/unit/base.py
- changed work with config options (we have some difference in oslo config)

glance/tests/unit/v1/test_registry_api.py
- removed class TestRegistryDb() - now we use db connection from common code,
  so it was already tested.

  to changes in `glance/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py` file.

  in common code now.

glance/db/sqlalchemy/api.py
- removed function for work witn database lovel (_wrap_db_error(),
  _is_db_connection_error(), _get_maker(), get_engine(),
  _ping_listener()) and config `sql_connection_opt`. We have this
  data in module `glance.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy`.
- modified functions setup_db_env(), add_cli_options(),
  clear_db_env().
- functions _get_session() and get_engine() now call same
  functions from module `glance.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy`.
- replaced sqlalchemy exception `sqlalchemy.exc.IntegrityError` to
  database duplicate exception - `db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry`.

glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/012_id_to_uuid.py
- removed `meta` from global module functions to fixed race condition.

glance/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py
- general refactioring due to changes in nova
  migration module
- removed functions upgrade() and downgrade()
- function db_sync() modified - it takes single
  argument now.

glance/db/sqlalchemy/models.py
- created new base base model class based on common db code instead of
  class ModelBase(object).

glance/tests/functional/db/test_sqlalchemy.py
- modified work with config

glance/tests/integration/legacy_functional/base.py
- removed code for work with env variable 'GLANCE_DB_TEST_SQLITE_FILE'. There
  is a sense to use sqlite in memory only.

glance/tests/unit/base.py
- changed work with config options (we have some difference in oslo config)

glance/tests/unit/v1/test_registry_api.py
- removed class TestRegistryDb() - now we use db connection from common code,
  so it was already tested.

glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/026_rename_unique_constraints.py
- renamed unique constraints due to common name convention

glance/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py
- patched sqlalchemy-migrate to fix UC bugs in SQLite

Global variable _ENGINE was replaced common function get_engine().

', 'number': 24}, {'created': '2013-11-25 15:17:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use common Oslo database session

Use common oslo database code for work with session, connection, engines
instead of glance implementations.
Work with config options modified due to new common code config.
Removed unused glance code and tests for it.

Details:

glance/cmd/manage.py
- removed load load the glance-registry config. We load sql connection
  in common code now.

glance/db/sqlalchemy/api.py
- removed functions _wrap_db_error(), _is_db_connection_error(),
  _get_maker(), get_engine(), _ping_listener() and config
  `sql_connection_opt`. We have all these thigs in module
  `glance.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy`.
- modified functions setup_db_env(), add_cli_options(), clear_db_env().
- functions _get_session() and get_engine() now call same functions
  from module `glance.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy`.
- replaced sqlalchemy exception `sqlalchemy.exc.IntegrityError` to
  database duplicate exception - `db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry`.

glance/tests/unit/v1/test_registry_api.py
- removed class TestRegistryDb() - now we use db connection from common
  code, so it was already tested.

Global variable _ENGINE was replaced by common function get_engine().

New database config options came from Oslo. See Table below

-------------------------------------------------------------------
Database config options ([group] option)
-----------------------------|-------------------------------------
       Glance                | Oslo
-----------------------------|-------------------------------------
[DEFAULT] sql_connection     |  [database] connection
[DEFAULT] sql_idle_timeout   |  [database] idle_timeout
[DEFAULT] sql_max_retries    |  [database] max_retries
[DEFAULT] sql_retry_interval |  [database] retry_interval
[DEFAULT] db_auto_create     |  NONE
[DEFAULT] sqlalchemy_debug   |  [database] connection_debug
NONE                         |  [database] slave_connection
NONE                         |  [database] min_pool_size
NONE                         |  [database] max_pool_size
NONE                         |  [database] slave_connection
NONE                         |  [database] min_pool_size
NONE                         |  [database] max_pool_size
NONE                         |  [database] max_overflow
NONE                         |  [database] connection_trace
NONE                         |  [database] pool_timeout
