revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-26 09:52:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix NoSuchOptError in lbaas agent test

Option 'periodic_interval' is registered by cfg.CONF.register_opts(), we
shouldn't mock this method.

Change-Id: I5ef02d6fa154ea7a18ca77d02a2704b7e3990c3b
Closes-Bug: #1264260
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-12-26 15:46:28.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/services/loadbalancer/drivers/haproxy/test_agent.py'], 'message': "Fix NoSuchOptError in lbaas agent test

Option 'periodic_interval' doesn't exist when using testtools
to test lbaas agent, fix this by adding a mock object.

Change-Id: I5ef02d6fa154ea7a18ca77d02a2704b7e3990c3b
Closes-Bug: #1264260
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix NoSuchOptError in lbaas agent test

Option 'periodic_interval' doesn't exist when using testtools
to test lbaas agent, fix this by adding a mock object.

Change-Id: I5ef02d6fa154ea7a18ca77d02a2704b7e3990c3b
Closes-Bug: #1264260

commit_message:
Add base utils for keystone benchmarks

This patch introduce keystone benchmarks with keystone base utils
+ add 2 keystone benchmark scenarios:
1) create_user - just create user one by one
2) create_delete_user - create & delete user

Add tests for utils and benchmarks

Samples included

blueprint keystone-benchmark

Change-Id: I9362135877bb1bc904fc8ed93c74eba89686e78a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-31 15:18:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "nicira: fix db integrity error during port deletion

Due to the fact that plugin port operations are not
transactional (as they involve non synchronized DB
and Controller operations), concurrent (interleaved)
port requests may accidentally cause the insertion
of the mapping entry (neutron-port-id, nvp-port-id)
more than once. In case this occurs, it's safe to
expect the failure and continue the normal process
of the operation being requested.

Closes-bug: 1265081

Change-Id: Ifcf5b453fa08145df844c2de3cbb08bf2f4baa59
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-12-31 17:31:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/nicira/dbexts/nicira_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/nicira/test_nicira_db.py'], 'message': "nicira: fix db integrity error during port deletion

Due to the fact that plugin port operations are not
transactional (as they involve non synchronized DB
and Controller operations), concurrent (interleaved)
port requests may accidentally cause the insertion
of the mapping entry (neutron-port-id, nvp-port-id)
more than once. In case this occurs, it's safe to
expect the failure and continue the normal process
of the operation being requested.

Closes-bug: #1265081

Change-Id: Ifcf5b453fa08145df844c2de3cbb08bf2f4baa59
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
nicira: fix db integrity error during port deletion

Due to the fact that plugin port operations are not
transactional (as they involve non synchronized DB
and Controller operations), concurrent (interleaved)
port requests may accidentally cause the insertion
of the mapping entry (neutron-port-id, nvp-port-id)
more than once. In case this occurs, it's safe to
expect the failure and continue the normal process
of the operation being requested.

Closes-bug: #1265081

Change-Id: Ifcf5b453fa08145df844c2de3cbb08bf2f4baa59

subject: Fix migration 185 to work with old fkey names
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7069, 'name': 'Joshua Hesketh', 'email': 'josh@nitrotech.org', 'username': 'jhesketh'}, {'_account_id': 7244, 'name': 'Victor Howard', 'email': 'victor.r.howard@gmail.com', 'username': 'vichoward'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-13 05:20:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix migration 185 to work with old fkey names

Migration 133_folsom.py accidentally changed the name of the FK
constraint on instance_info_caches from instance_info_caches_ibfk_1
to instance_info_caches_instance_uuid_fkey and on virtual_interfaces
from virtual_interfaces_ibfk_1 to
virtual_interfaces_instance_uuid_fkey meaning databases who have
upgraded from before folsom have the old fkey.

This patch adds a check for those with the old fkey name to make sure
it is dropped before changing unique constraints (as is required by
MySQL). It also fixes the fkey name to be as defined in 133 if it
wasn't before (which will persist on downgrade being consistent with
those who have come in after folsom).

Closes-Bug: #1245502

Change-Id: Ib0dcd04fcb9ed776c76d40561181abad2e14f76f
(cherry picked from commit c620cafb700ca195db0bd0ef9d62a0c9459bdc38)
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-12-02 17:08:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/185_rename_unique_constraints.py'], 'message': "Fix migration 185 to work with old fkey names

Due to different versions of MySQL it is possible to end up with
different FK's then what is expected. For example the FK constraint
on instance_info_caches changed from instance_info_caches_ibfk_1
to instance_info_caches_instance_uuid_fkey and on virtual_interfaces
from virtual_interfaces_ibfk_1 to
virtual_interfaces_instance_uuid_fkey meaning databases who have
upgraded from before folsom may have the old fkey.

This patch adds a check for those with the old fkey name to make sure
it is dropped before changing unique constraints (as is required by
MySQL). It also fixes the fkey name to be as defined in 133 if it
wasn't before (which will persist on downgrade being consistent with
those who have come in after folsom).

Closes-Bug: #1245502

Change-Id: Ib0dcd04fcb9ed776c76d40561181abad2e14f76f
(cherry picked from commit c620cafb700ca195db0bd0ef9d62a0c9459bdc38)
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix migration 185 to work with old fkey names

Due to different versions of MySQL it is possible to end up with
different FK's then what is expected. For example the FK constraint
on instance_info_caches changed from instance_info_caches_ibfk_1
to instance_info_caches_instance_uuid_fkey and on virtual_interfaces
from virtual_interfaces_ibfk_1 to
virtual_interfaces_instance_uuid_fkey meaning databases who have
upgraded from before folsom may have the old fkey.

This patch adds a check for those with the old fkey name to make sure
it is dropped before changing unique constraints (as is required by
MySQL). It also fixes the fkey name to be as defined in 133 if it
wasn't before (which will persist on downgrade being consistent with
those who have come in after folsom).

Closes-Bug: #1245502

Change-Id: Ib0dcd04fcb9ed776c76d40561181abad2e14f76f
(cherry picked from commit c620cafb700ca195db0bd0ef9d62a0c9459bdc38)

Recently we've faced the fact that while in Nova you should check the readiness
of a resource by its "AVAILABLE" status, in Cinder that should be written in
lower case, i.e. "available". With this patch there will be no more worries

Change-Id: Ie93104b74ac25de46a1d2a5f0d23a3131aeecffa

commit_message:
Make resource status checking letter case independent

Recently we've faced the fact that while in Nova you should check the readiness
of a resource by its "AVAILABLE" status, in Cinder that should be written in
lower case, i.e. "available". With this patch there will be no more worries
about such details for benchmark scenario writers.

Blueprint benchmark-engine-refactoring

Change-Id: Ie93104b74ac25de46a1d2a5f0d23a3131aeecffa

commit_message:
Neutron: Define a utility function to add neutron service class

When enabling neutron service (i.e. enable_service q-xxx), related code
unconditionally adds a necessary plugin class to Q_SERVICE_PLUGIN_CLASSES.
Which may cause duplication in Q_SERVICE_PLUGIN_CLASSES when
Q_SERVICE_PLUGIN_CLASSES is explicitly specified in localrc.
As a result, neutron server fails to start.

This patch introduces a utility function to add service class,
and check duplication.

Closes-Bug: #1261291
Change-Id: Id2880c7647babfccc3e8d9fc60dd93c4b3997ed9

In install_docker.sh, we will restart docker service, then connect
to /var/run/docker.sock with retry mechanism.

At the first contacting with /var/run/docker.sock, when docker
service is not ready, it may complain some error.

Mute this false alarm.

Change-Id: If00a18d2e3ddee951662e272d47ae84215f16ad2
Closes-Bug: #1252087
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Mute false alarm when installing docker

In install_docker.sh, we will restart docker service, then connect
to /var/run/docker.sock with retry mechanism.

At the first contacting with /var/run/docker.sock, when docker
service is not ready, it may complain some error.

Mute this false alarm.

Change-Id: If00a18d2e3ddee951662e272d47ae84215f16ad2
Closes-Bug: #1252087

commit_message:
Fixed pbr install to not error out and fail if git is not installed

Fixed the issue where pbr was erroring out (file not found) when
running 'python setup.py egg_info' since it was trying to get the
.git directory even if git was not installed.

Closes bug 1245676

Change-Id: I31e1f86f10f18897774b49eb293aede31641db31

commit_message:
Update oslo.messaging to remove requirement for d2to1

In olso.messaging d2to1 was removed as requirement as of change
I81e3d4bf4eef833b0b55d17e2a55028972ea4b55 (which was update to
global requirements). If we update to >=1.3.0 then this change
is reflected - alleviating the need to manually install d2to1
which was causing problems for glance and tripleo as per the
related bug report.

Change-Id: Ib2b0b820e6a9e4a6debe1438d6a7a31e54e42b48
Closes-Bug: 1261253

subject: Have tox install via setup.py develop
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 16:53:00.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

commit_message:
Update check_uptodate.sh to be compatible with FreeBSD mktemp

This patch modifies the mktemp args so they work on FreeBSD/OSX as well
as Linux. Note that this patch does not address the problem with the
generate_sample.sh script not parsing its args in a portable way; that
will need to be fixed in oslo.

Change-Id: I4ed00db832edb9c56d3fd19493c22228ad008769

commit_message:
Rename instance_type to flavor in notifications

Renames 'instance_type' to 'flavor' in the notifications module except
for the 'instance_type' key in the notifications payload.

This patch deprecates the 'instance_type' key in the notifications
payload and adds the 'flavor' key with the same value.

The related tests are updated to rename instance_type to flavor, and an
assertion was added to the test_notification module which was not
testing the 'instance_type' key previously.

DocImpact: The 'instance_type' key in the notifications payload is
deprecated in Icehouse and replaced with the 'flavor' key.

Part of blueprint flavor-instance-type-dedup

Change-Id: If6be531df7ba62abc02f65a3d32575350a09a470

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-17 05:34:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'make rbd usable for ephemeral storage

Currently when using rbd as an image backend, nova downloads the
glance image to local disk and then copies it again into rbd.  This
can be very slow for large images, and wastes bandwidth as well as
disk space.

When the glance image is stored in the same ceph cluster, the data is
being pulled out and pushed back in unnecessarily. Instead, create a
copy-on-write clone of the image. This is a fast, and does not depend
on the size of the image. Instead of taking minutes, booting takes
seconds, and is not limited by the disk copy.

Add a direct_fetch() method to the image backend, so backends
like rbd can make optimizations like this. Try to use direct_fetch()
for the root disk when it comes from an image, but fall back to
fetch_to_raw() if direct_fetch() fails.

The majority of this code was taken from the cinder rbd driver.
The only new parts are the direct_fetch() method for the image
backend, and the small backwards-compatible interfaces changes
needed to make use of it.

fixes bug 1226351

Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

Change-Id: Ic9b9fbcb6e133cc9315581354f1b70ed7c9909ad
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-12-10 10:53:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/image/glance.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py', 'nova/virt/images.py'], 'message': 'make rbd usable for ephemeral storage

glance image to local disk and then copies it again into rbd.  This
can be very slow for large images, and wastes bandwidth as well as
disk space.

When the glance image is stored in the same ceph cluster, the data is

copy-on-write clone of the image. This is a fast, and does not depend
on the size of the image. Instead of taking minutes, booting takes
seconds, and is not limited by the disk copy.

Add a direct_fetch() method to the image backend, so backends
like rbd can make optimizations like this. Try to use direct_fetch()
for the root disk when it comes from an image, but fall back to
fetch_to_raw() if direct_fetch() fails.

The majority of this code was taken from the cinder rbd driver.
The only new parts are the direct_fetch() method for the image
backend, and the small backwards-compatible interfaces changes
needed to make use of it.

Closes-Bug: 1226351
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

Change-Id: Ic9b9fbcb6e133cc9315581354f1b70ed7c9909ad
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
make rbd usable for ephemeral storage

Currently when using rbd as an image backend, nova downloads the
glance image to local disk and then copies it again into rbd.  This
can be very slow for large images, and wastes bandwidth as well as
disk space.

When the glance image is stored in the same ceph cluster, the data is
being pulled out and pushed back in unnecessarily. Instead, create a
copy-on-write clone of the image. This is a fast, and does not depend
on the size of the image. Instead of taking minutes, booting takes
seconds, and is not limited by the disk copy.

Add a direct_fetch() method to the image backend, so backends
like rbd can make optimizations like this. Try to use direct_fetch()
for the root disk when it comes from an image, but fall back to
fetch_to_raw() if direct_fetch() fails.

The majority of this code was taken from the cinder rbd driver.
The only new parts are the direct_fetch() method for the image
backend, and the small backwards-compatible interfaces changes
needed to make use of it.

Closes-Bug: 1226351
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

Change-Id: Ic9b9fbcb6e133cc9315581354f1b70ed7c9909ad

commit_message:
Only reverify backing lun when create backing lun

In TgtAdm, we alway do twice _verify_backing_lun whether backing lun
exists or not.
If backing lun exists, it doesn't need to call _verify_backing_lun
function again.
It only needs reverify whether backing lun exists or not when recreate
backing lun.

Change-Id: Ic11d778362540df307056a1adcba932e571b7d20
Closes-Bug: #1262958

Fix RateLimit.__repr__ - self.method is undefined

Using self.verb instead of self.method, unit tests added to cover this fix.

Closes-bug: #1258489

subject: Add AllocatedCapacityWeigher
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-23 07:03:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add AllocatedCapacityWeigher

AllocatedCapacityWeigher is a weigher that weigh hosts by their
allocated capacity. The main purpose of this weigher is to simulate
the SimpleScheduler's behavior, which sorts hosts by the size of
all volumes on them.  So by allocated capacity, it equals to the
sum of size of all volumes on target host.

In order to keep track of 'allocated' capacity, host state is updated
to add a 'allocated_capacity_gb' attribute to record the value, which
means each back-end must report one extra stats to scheduler.
Fortunately, the 'allocated' capacity we are interested in here is
pure Cinder level capacity, the volume manager can take all the burden
to calculate this value without having to query back-ends. The volume
manager does the initial calculation in init_host() by the time when it
has to query all existing volumes from DB for ensure_export(). After
initial calculation is done, volume manager/scheduler will keep track
of every new 'create' request it serves to make sure 'allocated_capacity'
is up to date.

Partially implement: deprecate-chance-and-simple-schedulers

Change-Id: I306230b8973c2d1ad77bcab14ccde68e997ea816
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-12-23 07:43:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add AllocatedCapacityWeigher

AllocatedCapacityWeigher is a weigher that weigh hosts by their
allocated capacity. The main purpose of this weigher is to simulate
the SimpleScheduler's behavior, which sorts hosts by the size of
all volumes on them.  So by allocated capacity, it equals to the
sum of size of all volumes on target host.

In order to keep track of 'allocated' capacity, host state is updated
to add a 'allocated_capacity_gb' attribute to record the value, which
means each back-end must report one extra stats to scheduler.
Fortunately, the 'allocated' capacity we are interested in here is
pure Cinder level capacity, the volume manager can take all the burden
to calculate this value without having to query back-ends. The volume
manager does the initial calculation in init_host() by the time when it
has to query all existing volumes from DB for ensure_export(). After
initial calculation, volume manager/scheduler will keep track of every
new request that changes 'allocated_capacity' and make sure this value
is up to date.

!DriverImpact! Cinder driver developers, please read on:

This patch contains a change that might IMPACT volume drivers: a previous
private element '_stats' of driver has been changed to 'stats' so that
volume manager is able to alter this structure with latest
'allocated_capacity'.  Please *DO NOT OVERWRITE* 'stats' with information
that driver fetched from back-end when doing 'get_volume_stats()',
instead, please *UPDATE* 'stats' when needed, since 'stats' is now also
being updated by volume manager.

Partially implements bp: deprecate-chance-and-simple-schedulers

Change-Id: I306230b8973c2d1ad77bcab14ccde68e997ea816
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-12-23 16:41:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add AllocatedCapacityWeigher

Fortunately, the 'allocated' capacity we are interested in here is

initial calculation, volume manager/scheduler will keep track of every
new request that changes 'allocated_capacity' and make sure this value
is up to date.

!DriverImpact! Cinder driver developers, please read on:

This patch contains a change that might IMPACT volume drivers: a previous
private element '_stats' of driver has been changed to 'stats' so that
volume manager is able to alter this structure with latest
'allocated_capacity'.  Please *DO NOT OVERWRITE* 'stats' with information
that driver fetched from back-end when doing 'get_volume_stats()',

being updated by volume manager.

Partially implements bp: deprecate-chance-and-simple-schedulers

Change-Id: I306230b8973c2d1ad77bcab14ccde68e997ea816
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2013-12-24 08:58:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add AllocatedCapacityWeigher

AllocatedCapacityWeigher is a weigher that weigh hosts by their
allocated capacity. The main purpose of this weigher is to simulate
the SimpleScheduler's behavior, which sorts hosts by the size of
all volumes on them.  So by allocated capacity, it equals to the
sum of size of all volumes on target host.

In order to keep track of 'allocated' capacity, host state is updated
to add a 'allocated_capacity_gb' attribute to record the value, which
means each back-end must report one extra stats to scheduler.
Fortunately, the 'allocated' capacity we are interested in here is
pure Cinder level capacity, the volume manager can take all the burden
to calculate this value without having to query back-ends. The volume
manager does the initial calculation in init_host() by the time when it
has to query all existing volumes from DB for ensure_export(). After
initial calculation, volume manager/scheduler will keep track of every
new request that changes 'allocated_capacity' and make sure this value
is up to date.

!DriverImpact! Cinder driver developers, please read on:

This patch contains a change that might IMPACT volume drivers: volume
manager now uses 'stats' attribute to save 'allocated_capacity_gb'.
And this information will be merged with those stats drivers provide
as a whole for scheduler to consume.  If you plan to report any form
of allocated space other than the apparent Cinder level value, (e.g.
actual capacity allocated), Please choose a key name other than
'allocated_capacity_gb', otherwise it will *OVERWRITE* the value volume
manager has calculated and confuse scheduler.

Partially implements bp: deprecate-chance-and-simple-schedulers

Change-Id: I306230b8973c2d1ad77bcab14ccde68e997ea816
", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2013-12-24 13:26:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add AllocatedCapacityWeigher

AllocatedCapacityWeigher is a weigher that weigh hosts by their
allocated capacity. The main purpose of this weigher is to simulate
the SimpleScheduler's behavior, which sorts hosts by the size of
all volumes on them.  So by allocated capacity, it equals to the
sum of size of all volumes on target host.

In order to keep track of 'allocated' capacity, host state is updated
to add a 'allocated_capacity_gb' attribute to record the value, which
means each back-end must report one extra stats to scheduler.
Fortunately, the 'allocated' capacity we are interested in here is
pure Cinder level capacity, the volume manager can take all the burden
to calculate this value without having to query back-ends. The volume
manager does the initial calculation in init_host() by the time when it
has to query all existing volumes from DB for ensure_export(). After
initial calculation, volume manager/scheduler will keep track of every
new request that changes 'allocated_capacity' and make sure this value
is up to date.

!DriverImpact! Cinder driver developers, please read on:

This patch contains a change that might IMPACT volume drivers: volume
manager now uses 'stats' attribute to save 'allocated_capacity_gb'.
And this information will be merged with those stats drivers provide
as a whole for scheduler to consume.  If you plan to report any form
of allocated space other than the apparent Cinder level value, (e.g.
actual capacity allocated), Please choose a key name other than
'allocated_capacity_gb', otherwise it will *OVERWRITE* the value volume
manager has calculated and confuse scheduler.

Partially implements bp: deprecate-chance-and-simple-schedulers

Change-Id: I306230b8973c2d1ad77bcab14ccde68e997ea816

commit_message:
Add AllocatedCapacityWeigher

AllocatedCapacityWeigher is a weigher that weigh hosts by their
allocated capacity. The main purpose of this weigher is to simulate
the SimpleScheduler's behavior, which sorts hosts by the size of
all volumes on them.  So by allocated capacity, it equals to the
sum of size of all volumes on target host.

In order to keep track of 'allocated' capacity, host state is updated
to add a 'allocated_capacity_gb' attribute to record the value, which
means each back-end must report one extra stats to scheduler.
Fortunately, the 'allocated' capacity we are interested in here is
pure Cinder level capacity, the volume manager can take all the burden
to calculate this value without having to query back-ends. The volume
manager does the initial calculation in init_host() by the time when it
has to query all existing volumes from DB for ensure_export(). After
initial calculation, volume manager/scheduler will keep track of every
new request that changes 'allocated_capacity' and make sure this value
is up to date.

!DriverImpact! Cinder driver developers, please read on:

This patch contains a change that might IMPACT volume drivers: volume
manager now uses 'stats' attribute to save 'allocated_capacity_gb'.
And this information will be merged with those stats drivers provide
as a whole for scheduler to consume.  If you plan to report any form
of allocated space other than the apparent Cinder level value, (e.g.
actual capacity allocated), Please choose a key name other than
'allocated_capacity_gb', otherwise it will *OVERWRITE* the value volume
manager has calculated and confuse scheduler.

Partially implements bp: deprecate-chance-and-simple-schedulers

Change-Id: I306230b8973c2d1ad77bcab14ccde68e997ea816

commit_message:
Fix QoS information in initialize_connection() result

Currently the entire QoS information (if any) is included in the result of
initialize_connection() even if the consumer of the QoS is 'back-end'. Also
the format for QoS specs also is changed so that front-end (Nova) can
parse correctly. Add unit test to cover initialize_connection().

Closes-bug: 1259957

DocImpact

(cherry-pick: e40dafd54411f0e4648fc051ef4d9c806f337f9d)

Change-Id: Ibc5e92cc1ddf6404e5b234ef524698feae282eec

commit_message:
Fixes message logged on XenAPI Glance plugin retries

Closes-Bug: 1265054
Retry logic is now being used for both upload_vhd and download_vhd,
but nova/virt/xenapi/client/session.py still had 'upload_vhd'
hardcoded in its logged messages. This causes it to accept the
function being used as an argument, or use the more generic
'glance call' if the argument is not passed.

-DEmmons

Change-Id: I1520564fbe406c723fb00cca5e47c69ac65d1642

commit_message:
DRY queues storage error message format

This reduces the lines of codes by having all the errors inherit
from a base class. This base class takes keyword arguments and
formats all the error messages uniformly.

Closes-Bug: #1260392

Change-Id: I77fcd14e9fb8989c29e0796d813ef587a26f9199

commit_message:
Remove dynamic default on sf_account_prefix

A dynamic default makes it difficult to generate
a proper cinder.conf.sample template. Make it
default to the hostname when the option is unset
or left at default.

DocImpact: default of sf_account_prefix changed to "None", which
however preserves behavior of a previously unset option: use
the current hostname.

Change-Id: Ic90305bd93ae0156c37e32012cdc32848192de07

commit_message:
Remove vim header

No need to set tabstop tons of times, this can be set in your vimrc
file instead.

More disucssion:
http://openstack.10931.n7.nabble.com/Remove-vim-modelines-td21780.html

Partial-Bug: #1229324
Change-Id: Ib3a31c8819ee1950d72f7da5627593623d351560

revisions:

"Stack not found" as the error message is incorrect while describing
events of an exist stack with non-existent resource.

We should just use the message that the server sent the client.

Change-Id: I213474577512e9a56d8c2802e90d76b9c4324c13
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix inappropriate error message on event-list

"Stack not found" as the error message is incorrect while describing
events of an exist stack with non-existent resource.

We should just use the message that the server sent the client.
Closes-Bug: #1264944

Change-Id: I213474577512e9a56d8c2802e90d76b9c4324c13

commit_message:
Added 'auth_uri' key to neutron.conf on controller node

I added configuration of the 'auth_uri' key to neutron.conf on the
controller node to eliminate a warning about potential endpoint
authentication issues in the Neutron server log.

Change-Id: I977fe53964a4a17fb0e28f0487f60bcffa828b1f
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1264166

subject: Fixes Invalid cross-device link issue
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-31 13:48:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes Invalid cross-device link issue

Uses shutil.move instead of os.rename. This fixes the "OSError: [Errno
18] Invalid cross-device link" error message obtained when running tox
with python-keystoneclient on a different filesystem than /tmp. In
this case, os.rename raises an exception while shutil.move does the
job by copying/deleting the appropriate files.

Change-Id: Ic34e921126312006f8a0a8a01d66ca2ebf6b660c
Closes-Bug: #1265190
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-12-31 14:39:19.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py'], 'message': 'Fixes Invalid cross-device link issue

Uses shutil.move instead of os.rename. This fixes the "OSError: [Errno
18] Invalid cross-device link" error message obtained when running tox
with python-keystoneclient on a different filesystem than /tmp. In
this case, os.rename raises an exception while shutil.move does the

Closes-Bug: #1265190
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fixes Invalid cross-device link issue

Uses shutil.move instead of os.rename. This fixes the "OSError: [Errno
18] Invalid cross-device link" error message obtained when running tox
with python-keystoneclient on a different filesystem than /tmp. In
this case, os.rename raises an exception while shutil.move does the
job by copying/deleting the appropriate files.

Change-Id: Ic34e921126312006f8a0a8a01d66ca2ebf6b660c
Closes-Bug: #1265190

subject: Initial support for gating api-site
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-23 21:16:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'First support for gating api-site

With these changes we can create two gates for checking the
repository api-site:
doctest.py --force --check-build --api-site
doctest.py --check-niceness --api-site

Note that the other checks need further work. Also, --check-build
really needs --force to build everything since the dependency
generation does not handle the xml code of the repo yet.

Change-Id: I214b4837401b2bcd46e5c6fa2e71b118254490d6

commit_message:
Initial support for gating api-site

With these changes we can create new gates for checking the
repository api-site as well as the API site repositories:
doctest.py --force --check-build --api-site
doctest.py --check-niceness --api-site
doctest.py --check-syntax --api-site

This checks also wadl files for syntax and niceness.

Note that the other checks need further work. Also, --check-build
really needs --force to build everything since the dependency
generation does not handle the xml code of the repo yet.
The building only works on api-site yet, needs more work for the other
projects.

The functions validate_all_files and validate_individual_files have been
refactored to use one common function - thus removing some duplicated
code.

Change-Id: I214b4837401b2bcd46e5c6fa2e71b118254490d6

commit_message:
Fix typo'ed deprecated flag names in libvirt.imagebackend

In nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py, the images_rbd_pool
and images_rbd_ceph_conf have deprecated_name set to
libvirt_images_rdb_pool and libvirt_images_rdb_ceph_conf,
respectively, but the actual option names prior to commit
25a7de2054ba6ae5eb318c86fe165f4302fbfff8 are
libvirt_images_rbd_pool and libvirt_images_rbd_ceph_conf.
(Note the transposition of the d and b in rbd.)

Closes-bug: #1262858

Change-Id: I47f4ff6e03674c825336d26b610eeff89e48d21e

It is simpler and does not require a call to sed.

commit_message:
Make markdown-docbook.sh more robust

Similar to how we do it in build-ha-guide.sh:
* Check for location of db4-upgrade.xsl to allow building on
  different distributions
* Check for existence of used scripts and abort with failure
* Reformat to avoid overlong lines

Change-Id: I3e2451e9c66530cd0268e9edfd910bdf4a4ebd2e

subject: Delete instance faults when the instance is deleted
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-31 02:32:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Delete instance faults when the instance is deleted

When we delete an instance, we should soft delete the instance
faults as well, so that this table doesn't grow forever. Because
it is a soft delete it is still possible for admins to do
reporting on all faults seen until a table cleanup occurs.

DocImpact: if we have a place in the manuals where we cover the
instance fault table, we should mention this deletion behaviour.

Change-Id: Ib62b9be03b047f833fe681139dbffb5b8d5ade99
Closes-bug: #1237155
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Delete instance faults when the instance is deleted

When we delete an instance, we should soft delete the instance
faults as well, so that this table doesn't grow forever. Because
it is a soft delete it is still possible for admins to do
reporting on all faults seen until a table cleanup occurs.

DocImpact: if we have a place in the manuals where we cover the
instance fault table, we should mention this deletion behaviour.

Change-Id: Ib62b9be03b047f833fe681139dbffb5b8d5ade99
Closes-bug: #1237155

commit_message:
Properly catch timeout exception raised in thread

The Timeout exception raised by eventlet is subclass of
BaseException, not Exception. So we need to catch the former.

Fixes bug: #1263068

Change-Id: I3d63493a2ff99585436aa68e510047d7f4e61345

[{'created': '2013-12-10 21:48:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adding security rules for ingress/egress doesn't work properly

Avoiding setting the direction as "ingress" when
selected from the combo.
If there it is a value for the direction in the
local_settings.py it is used.
The actual behavior is that always is setting direction
as "ingress" when choosing one of the ALL* rules
(ALL ICMP, ALL TCP and ALL UDP).
When this happens if you previously has crated an
ALL TCP (direction: ingress) and then you add a new
ALL TCP (direction: egress) it fails
as they are the same rule (direction: ingress).
Also, if you add a ALL TCP (direction: egress) rule first,
it is created with direction: ingress.

Change-Id: I0b54c633bc0f0d45ba2a40cdc82bfa2bc880a086
Closes-Bug: #1254040

commit_message:
Adding security rules for ingress/egress doesn't work properly

The idea of the patch is to avoid the combo value overwrite
when there is no "direction" value in the settings file.
This fixes the problem of always having and "ingress"
direction, even when set manually by the combo.
If there it is a value for the direction in the
local_settings.py it is used.
The actual behavior is that always is setting direction
as "ingress" when choosing one of the ALL* rules
(ALL ICMP, ALL TCP and ALL UDP).

Change-Id: I0b54c633bc0f0d45ba2a40cdc82bfa2bc880a086
Closes-Bug: #1254040

commit_message:
Add PortCheck resource

This resource waits for services to begin accepting connections during
stack creation. Unlike WaitCondition, this does not rely on creating a
user, or any cooperation on the part of the guest operating system.
(e.g. no need for the cfn tools to be installed in your base images).

It is only a suitable replacement for a WaitCondition in use cases
where the service being waited on is globally reachable (or at least
reachable from the node running the Heat engine).

Change-Id: I34900635bbb7de8f914bbce4266ecfafbc9f961e

commit_message:
Rename _get_bdm_image_metadata to reflect that it is no longer private

Change 4493c2790e9d672b20b44ec6e09fa612f75d186b added a call from
api/openstack/compute/servers.py to a private method of compute/api.py
This change is a simple rename of that method to reflect that it is no longer
private.

Change-Id: Iec4ae66005008ee8de60204f4e3dee0582ae7472

', 'number': 18}, {'created': '2013-09-11 17:30:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes extensions api to resolve namespace

-- When importing extension module(s) the full namespace
should be used so when extensions are checked for
plugin implementation, a base class comparison
can be done.
-- Removes check for base class inheritance based on
None type.
-- Changes default plugin interface on ExtensionDescriptor
to NeutronPluginBaseV2 (i.e. default plugin base class).
This leaves default behavior as long as targeted plugin
derives from the common base class. But prior to this
change, a targeted non-common class could not be used.

Fixes Bug #1211513

commit_message:
Fixes extensions api to use full namespace

-- When importing extension module(s) the full namespace
should be used so when extensions are checked for
plugin implementation, a base class comparison
can be done.
-- Removes check for base class inheritance based on
None type.
-- Changes default plugin interface on ExtensionDescriptor
to NeutronPluginBaseV2 (i.e. default plugin base class).
This leaves default behavior as long as targeted plugin
derives from the common base class.

Fixes Bug #1211513

Change-Id: I53b17d3cbb1a67b21330c5e0da8d5240ac010f3a

commit_message:
add test.rc file to source and .gitignore addition

added to .gitignore some extra generated files
test.rc can be used to source and use the trove cli as the same user as
the tests. This will allow you to view/cleanup the test users instances.

Closes-bug: 1261829
Change-Id: I1f5fc0133240ae9184e34d61413332457c13e2fa

commit_message:
Work around portability bugs in generate_sample.sh

This patch disables the use of check_uptodate.sh in the tox pep8 env,
since that script depends on oslo's generate_sample.sh script, which is
broken on OS X.

Change-Id: I3b5ffdb61011b880b98117f3868c3dbe9d2d7c1c

commit_message:
Convert requires_ext decorators to be classmethods

This commit converts the is_extension_enabled function and the
requires_ext decorator to be classmethods in the base test class.
Using decorators that call TempestConfig() will cause a dependency
at import on a working config file.

Partially implements bp config-cleanup

Change-Id: I478b2f25b7accbe59ce2821473d55d5f5d58815c

commit_message:
Add checks on aggregate's metadata

There is no checks on aggregate's metadata, the metadata's keys accept
empty string, the empty string should be not meaningful. So we add checks
on it.

Change-Id: I871d3354627445622607dcc8dcb215e8eefbab09
Closes-Bug:#1262943

commit_message:
Initial rubocop support.

Per the mailing list thread, introducing Rubocop as a replacement for Tailor.
Assuming Jenkins likes this, more pedantic patches will follow to make Rubocop
happy.

commit_message:
List NotImplementedError as a client exception for spice

Not all drivers implement the get_spice_console method.  In that case,
they will raise NotImplementedError.  List this exception as a client
exception so that the rpc layer does not log a traceback when this
happens.

Change-Id: Ic5b138837c80f30761c89bcec01d9a2d0506a596

commit_message:
Display the location in v1 image-show output

When running glance --debug image-show <ID> a user can see the location
information of the specified image id. This commit make this information
available directly in the output of glance image-show <ID>

Change-Id: I8401b09a3825185b00a2ce92792ee822944704b2
Implements: blueprint glance-image-show-location

commit_message:
Adds misc options

This change adds support for miscellaneous options to be set.
Things that haven't been added as attributes, or specifically,
third party additions that don't belong in stackforge (e.g. cobalt)

Add db2 support to neutron on redhat platform

Add a new attribute
default["openstack"]["network"]["platform"]["db2_python_packages"]
and add install DB python packages block in common recipe

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 21:09:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add initial Savanna CLI

This commit provides the framework for the Savanna CLI. It is based on
the python-novaclient. novaclient was chosen because of its maturity
and the ubiquity in which it has been previously copied, i.e. we're in
the same boat as most everyone else. The goal is to keep modifications
in Savanna's copy to a minimum. To that end, much of the novaclient
code is retained, though commented out when it is not
applicable. Additionally, the Savanna CLI depends on novaclient for
classes. That dependency can be broken in the future by copying
classes into savannaclient.

A simple plugins-list/show command is provided with the framework for
demonstration and testing purposes.

Change-Id: I6bbbc86135d6cb16e088dd76261fdef29c2cb929
Implements: blueprint python-savannaclient-cli

commit_message:
Add initial Savanna CLI

This commit provides the framework for the Savanna CLI. It is based on
the python-novaclient. novaclient was chosen because of its maturity
and the ubiquity in which it has been previously copied, i.e. we're in
the same boat as most everyone else. The goal is to keep modifications
in Savanna's copy to a minimum. To that end, much of the novaclient
code is retained, though commented out when it is not applicable.

A simple plugins-list/show command is provided with the framework for
demonstration and testing purposes.

Change-Id: I6bbbc86135d6cb16e088dd76261fdef29c2cb929
Implements: blueprint python-savannaclient-cli

commit_message:
Add initial Python SDK docs to user guide

Initial addition of Python SDK content to user's guide. Describes
how an end-user can employ the Python bindings to automate tasks.

This initial commit adds info on:
 - How to authenticate with Identity, Commpute, Image, and Network
   clients
 - How to manage images

Change-Id: Ie8c4120acc7739c0bc4bddd99ffdbfbfbe241e0f

commit_message:
Fix for qemu-nbd hang

NBD device once used seem to run into intermittent trouble when
used with mount repeatedly. Adding code to explicitly flush the
device buffers using 'blockdev --flushbufs'.

Closes-Bug: #973413
Partial-Bug: #1254890
Change-Id: I2b7053b9a069d6e82f6f6baf9ad480efa4388d91

commit_message:
Add pyudev to requirements.txt

neutron.plugins.linux_bridge.agent.linux_neutron_bridge_agent imports
pyudev, but pyudev is not in requirements.txt, which causes unit tests
to fail to run.

Change-Id: Ia82a4297078909915b49eafea406961bef4b4d43
Reference: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-December/023122.html
Closes-Bug: #1264687

commit_message:
Use wrapper create_volume() in volume tests

There is wrapper create_volume() in base.py of volume tests, the method
creates a volume with 1GB size in default and registered the volume for
deleting it when tests finish.
However, the method is not used at many places and similar codes exist
for the same purpose.

This patch makes the volume tests use this wrapper create_volume() for
cleaning up. Some tests do not use wrapper create_volume() after applying
this patch, because these tests are for testing create_volume API and
it is better to call the API directly without wrapper method.

Change-Id: I6d18d92984119f137801b56f3442d0c5851e0ef1

commit_message:
Migrate to pbr

OpenStack uses pbr for setuptools/build and version releases. As
barbican looks towards incubation, migrate to being pbr based.

Removes unneeded details from the error message

Also removing the field expectation lines from the test code, to get
past the zuul unit test gate check. This is a temporary fix and we'll
change the test code per
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/barbican/+spec/validation-improve-err-msgs

commit_message:
Redundant size check in volume restore api

In cinder volume restore api, we do twice size check when restore volume
with a given volume uuid. It's necessary to remove the redundant check.

Change-Id: I8f240b2c0d1014d212ff56c2c9b5e193f9d552bd
Closes-Bug: #1264053

commit_message:
Introduce keystone_url parameter

This parameter deprecates keystone_host, keystone_port & keystone_scheme
and allows to pass a complete url.

Implements blueprint serve-keystone-from-wsgi

Change-Id: Ia8aa6e6377abf0e84427174fb946f4efa5defa12

commit_message:
Install Guide: Add table documenting reserved UIDs

Add a table documenting the reserved UIDs that are used by
OpenStack.
This is information that belongs IMO into an appendix, let's make
it specific for each distribution.

backport: none
Change-Id: I66f861b4ad84231af5053826dbc47df4d91bc0b9
Closes-Bug: #1239879

commit_message:
Make code base E125 and E126 compliant

This commit makes the glance code base E125 and E126 compliant :
  * E125 continuation line does not distinguish itself from next logical line
  * E126 continuation line over-indented for hanging indent

Change-Id: I7120149bedb665fb66320498fe98948602a6cd52
Closes-bug: #1263437

commit_message:
Add generic keystone cleanup mechanism

We should delete all created by benchmark resources:
"users", "roles", "services", "tenants" after benchmark execution.

We decide to use specific template in names.
(all names starts with "rally_k_" so we are able easy to check was
this resource created by benchmark or not).

blueprint keystone-benchmark

Change-Id: If5372138410a160c693314ebf0e728efd2682814

commit_message:
Neutron Quotas Negative Tests

Implementation of Neutron Quota Negative Tests as documented in
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/icehouse-summit-qa-neutron

Includes quotas reset operation for the network XML client
to support testing the XML API.

Change-Id: I3b2e6f336537450040b20e0a604dff614fdb27dc

commit_message:
Moves negative tests from test_multiple_create

This change set moves the negative tests in test_multiple_create to
a new file test_multiple_create_negative

Also removes usage of modules directly.

Note: HACKING.rst
The second requirement is that all negative tests must be added to a negative
test file. If such a file doesn't exist for the particular resource being
tested a new test file should be added

Change-Id: I7be8f8f28bde13305a47037eadbbf7859a7d471f

commit_message:
Don't compress disk images for tripleo-cd.

Nova baremetal just uncompresses them anyway, and we're not archiving
them. This should save a few minutes per image.

Change-Id: I4539de0d423701cf2715fff06923a803fe096368

subject: Use encode() instead of strutils.safe_encode() in fake_client
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 668, 'name': 'Adrian Otto', 'email': 'aotto@aotto.com', 'username': 'aotto'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 8334, 'name': 'Noorul Islam K M', 'email': 'noorul@noorul.com', 'username': 'noorul'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-22 11:28:58.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/apiclient/fake_client.py'], 'message': 'Use encode() instead of strutils.safe_encode() in fake_client

Patch [1] broke expectation of patch [2] from safe_encode method. Patch
[2] was expecting safe_encode to return an object of type bytes but that
was changed by patch [1]. Somehow python requests package expects bytes
object even in python 3, so just encode the content in fake_client.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/62345
[2] https://review.openstack.org/58808

Change-Id: I5eb433c614d95742c05798f5a90af5e5692508b6
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use encode() instead of strutils.safe_encode() in fake_client

Patch [1] broke expectation of patch [2] from safe_encode method. Patch
[2] was expecting safe_encode to return an object of type bytes but that
was changed by patch [1]. Somehow python requests package expects bytes
object even in python 3, so just encode the content in fake_client.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/62345
[2] https://review.openstack.org/58808

Change-Id: I5eb433c614d95742c05798f5a90af5e5692508b6

Add -U flag to pip install command

The -U flag makes tox able to upgrade all packages to the newest available
version.

commit_message:
Add note about Linux Bridge MTU Bug w/ VXLAN tun

There's a horrible hard-to-diagnose bug when using vxlan tunelling.

This patch adds a note including the simple workaround.

Change-Id: I20a8ec46a91c7ffe1533338de5968d1b83badb6f
Closes-Bug: 1242534

commit_message:
Import markdown-docbook.sh from config

Import file from openstack-infra/config repository with filename
modules/jenkins/files/slave_scripts/markdown-docbook.sh

The file will be used for converting markdown to docbook.

Add this separately so that we can track changes to it more
easily.

Change-Id: I8d3a13d4b1126fa8845e2b5d5a4a9db6b23fbc64

subject: Relocated step to restart Neutron plug-in agent
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-30 09:07:14.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-install.xml'], 'message': 'Relocated step to restart Neutron plug-in agent

Relocated step to restart Neutron plug-in agent from section for
plug-in configuration to after completion of Neutron configuration.
This change allows the plug-in agent to read all configured values
from neutron.conf required for proper start and operation.

Implemented more generic phrasing with the Open vSwitch plug-in
agent as an example.

Change-Id: Ie6a614683271674678fc4d44f88c3fe47bb3b473
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1264163
(cherry picked from commit 59d8a718586bbf16257c8799b7821dd9f7a5a471)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Relocated step to restart Neutron plug-in agent

Relocated step to restart Neutron plug-in agent from section for
plug-in configuration to after completion of Neutron configuration.
This change allows the plug-in agent to read all configured values
from neutron.conf required for proper start and operation.

Implemented more generic phrasing with the Open vSwitch plug-in
agent as an example.

Change-Id: Ie6a614683271674678fc4d44f88c3fe47bb3b473
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1264163
(cherry picked from commit 59d8a718586bbf16257c8799b7821dd9f7a5a471)
